Reviews.Title: “Helpfull and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ian K
Reviews.Content: For those on a tight budget this is a good place to stay-We had just drove from San Francisco to LA and after a disappointing stay at our last hotel I was worried about the standard of this hotel because it was rated a 'star' lower. However we were greeted by friendly and helpfull staff although we were booked into smoking rooms, (not the fault of the hotel it was the travel companys fault). They made sure the rooms were still ok for us and I can say we were pleased with the overall quality. We arrived late but they informed us that there was a free shuttle bus going to Universal Studios in the next hr and could at least find our bearings and have a look around tonight. The staff printed maps and specific locations that we required for the following day/s and the bar was small but pleasant after a long day out. Starbucks and a great basic shopping centre across the road and various eating places in walking distance made this a great location. A taxi back from the 'Walk Of Fame' only cost $15 dollars so you can stay out longer without having to worry too much about getting back to catch the last shuttle from Universal Studios at 8pm. We didn't use the pool but had a balcony to catch the sun and relax.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: helb167
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in 2009 as part of a tour group. the hotel was friendly and nice and clean. the room i had was spacious and clean. it was at the back of the hotel so was quiet at night. we had breakfast in the dining area, it was nice continental, they gave me a fruit salad that contained pineapple, i am allergic to it so told the waitress and she got the chef to make me one without the pineapple. the bar area was nice in the evening and we spent a while in there after a busy day sightseeing. theres some nice restaurants down the road that we ate at and really enjoyed. would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: karie331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights last week while we visited our son-who lives just around the corner. We had a great time here and loved the quaint decor-the staff was very friendly and the breakfasts in the patio cafe were great! Rooms are good size and clean, the bathroom is a little small otherwise perfect for our visit! Also must eat at Casa Vega 1 night another treasure in this area that has been around for 50 plus years! We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosZena_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sportsmans for 5 nights in March, visiting our daughter in LA, she lives round the corner so the location was great for us . But we also found it a great location for other reasons, nice shops and restaurants nearby. The Hotel is a little dated in a kind of old style Hollywood way...and has a very relaxed ambience. We had a room on ground floor level overlooking the pool, which was a treat...a huge hot swimming pool ! The room was large and comfortable...we thoroughly enjoyed our time there and would definitely stay again. We didn't use the hotel bar and restaurant much so can't really comment on that, but thee is. Supermarket and Starbucks across the road which was useful !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room and Service”
Reviews.Author: deniseduong
Reviews.Content: Great location. The lobby is fabulous. Good beds, great pool, lovely service, and the food is fine. Don't get the fish tacos though. I enjoyed staying here. The decor is old in an oddly lovable way.

Reviews.Title: “One night turned to two!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sportmen's Lodge February 10-11. We were in the LA area to make a delivery, and figured we would stay the night and have some fun in the big city. The Sportsmen's is close to many great restaurants and bars on Ventura Blvd, so we didn't have to travel far. We enjoyed a lovely meal at Ahi Sushi the next block over, and had great cadillac margaritas at MexiCali a few blocks down the other way. Yes, the hotel is older and slightly warn, but the place has a great funky vibe going on. The lobby bar was only open in the evening, but we enjoyed great company with our fellow travelers over delicious mai tais and conversation about LA and Studio City. We had such a great day at the Sportsmen's, we decided to stay another night and soak up more of the city. The hotel is conveniently located with many restaurants, bars and shops within a few blocks. There's a grocery store across the street for those forgotten items, and it's just a few blocks off the freeway, making it very convenient. There was a some type of movie being filmed when we first got there, but in no way did we feel it distracted from the common areas of the hotel. The second night there was a huge class reunion party in the gardens by the pool, but the kids were having a great time, and quite frankly the noise of their revelry was downright cheerful. The staff we dealt with at check-in and other times were all very helpful and pleasant. When we initially checked in, the gentleman at the front desk asked if we had a AAA card, and he was able to give us a great discount with our card. He didn't have to do that! All in all, we've decided any time we come back to the Studio City area, we will definitely stay at the Sportsmen's Lodge. I was hesitant to reserve here initially, due to the myriad of unpleasant reviews, but I can say we were very happy with every aspect of our stay -- thanks Sportsmen's for a great weekend!! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place- lots of history”
Reviews.Author: agrathwol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and it was a fine accommodation- a bit worn, but still fun. Great location on Ventura Blvd in Studio City in central location in San fernanco Valley. Lots of history relative to Hollywood actors visiting there and trout-fishing in bygone days in the golden era. Bobby Kennedy spent his last night there before his assassination. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Worth the stay just to see photos of glamorous actors of the past who stayed there back in 20's thru 60's.

Reviews.Title: “Events Are The Priority Here, Not Guests”
Reviews.Author: beckiesandiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to LA once a year and always looking for "the hotel", I really wanted this place to be it. Looked good upon check-in, older, little funky- parking was easy.Was told no continenal breakfast disappointed, also thought travel book said rooms had frig and microwave, there weren't any. Funny- moldy, antiseptic smell in our hallway to our room. I could ignore that, if the rest were good. The room was fine, as promsed pool acess. The heated pool was great, the jacuzzi has a warning sign that it will strip your hair color. Couldn't stand the smell, it burned my eyes. Don't think it has to be that harsh, other places manage to tone that down. The walls are very thin, we could hear our neighbors tv. But all of this isn't the worst of it, at 6am on Sat morning we were wakened by noise outside our room, workers were sitting up tables for some event right in front of our pool acess. I called the front desk to ask what was the deal, they denied anything going on out by the pool. I said I see 6 round tables- oh those tables, the front desk said. Oh, tgey offered to move me, I was sick and I was leaving the next day, I wasn't moving. Yes, I could squeeze by the table in a wet bathing suit, but I wouldn't. There were other places to set up the lunch for the group there, why in my pool acess?? I happened to be very sick before their lunch, so I never got a chance to be inconvienced by the people. That said, I had to stay in my room that night, and I was jolted out of sleep at 8pm, by "Karens " dj. I wish I wouldn't have been sick, I would have joined the party. There is an open area and the noise just travels in between the building and bounces around. It was so loud, luckliy, I had ear plugs with me, so I could sleep my sickness away. Never been sick in a hotel room and I had the misfortune to be stuck in my room here. Bottom line at this place, EVENTS COME FIRST. If you've only paid for a room, and are a guest you are out of luck. I really wanted this place to be "IT", my hotel in LA. But I don't think so.

Reviews.Author: d p

Reviews.Title: “weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller33119
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Friday night was awful! Lots of partying everywhere. The noise was incredible. It took 3 calls to the front desk before things quieted down above us. Rooms are old but clean. And although they advertise a free continental breakfast, we were told that was no longer available. We picked this hotel for the convenience, and it is nicely located. However if you plan to be there on a weekend, be advised it is incredibly noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: priscilla001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice safe neighbourhoud near the hollywood sign. The hotel itself is not so exclusive. The rooms are a bit old and outdated. The staff seems occupied with all sorts of things and does not have a lot of time to answer questions of the quests (maybe its not their fault, but the management to blaim)

Reviews.Title: “Improved, but not enough”
Reviews.Author: ICCKI
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Sportsmen's off and on for over 18 years. It is somewhat shabby and needs upgrading in the rooms. It used to be dirty but seems cleaner than before (especially around the ice machines which are all located on the main floor - quite a trek). It is convenient when visiting family and there aren't many alternatives in the area. Very few amenities. I had difficulty getting a fresh liner for the ice bucket each day this time!

Reviews.Title: “great visit at Sportsmen's Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Lulueye
Reviews.Content: Big, clean room, clean bathroom with plenty of towels. My only complaint is that we couldn't get a roll-away bed for pour room, which caused a bit of a problem for us. Adequate continental breakfast, but breakfast in the cafe was wonderful. Kids enjoyed the pool, which was comfortably heated, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Needing some love...”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_Ben
Reviews.Content: Very pleasent hotel, ok location with loads of parkiing, however felt that the rooms and pulic places were a little tired and needing some attention. Good sized pool and very friendly bar tender that served u some much needed beer after a long flight!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: osofast2
Reviews.Content: This is an historic hotel. It has been remodeled. It has a mixed feeling of old and new. We stayed in the main hotel. It's the oldest part of the hotel. There is some kind of strange smell in the hallway but it doesn't come in the room. This hotel is close to everything. You do have to pay $10.00 for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Maid stole my wife's clothes & hotel is shabby anyway”
Reviews.Author: Pharmatraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first weekend in December there for a family function in the area and thought the place was nice. When we got home, my wife found that $1,200 of her jewelery and clothing was missing. We called the hotel to complain and said they would check to see who took care of our room. We called back and they told us that the maid who cleaned our room had suddenly left for Cuba (for family issues). We asked them to reimburse us for the stolen items and they referred us to their insurance carrier (Certus Claims) who referred us back to the hotel. I complained to the hotel and they wouldn't speak to me except to say to speak with Certus. Certus refuses to pay for anything. I am going to have to sue them in small claims court. I thought the maids are supposed to be bonded. Maybe they have illegals there???

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in heart of LA”
Reviews.Author: KathsGottaGo
Reviews.Content: My sister lives in Sherman Oaks and recommended this hotel. It is a great deal on a budget, so if no frills is what you need this fits the bill. We stayed here three nights for the Thanksgiving break and would recommend. I don't mind cheap and a little worn as long as it's really clean, and it was really clean. The rooms are really basic and we ate in the cafe one night and it was...okay, just like the rest of the hotel. Stay here if you are going to be out and about most of the time. I think in the summer, for families, it might be really fun because children would do well here and there is a huge pool with containment. Little things will go wrong (our door key) but the people are nice and you can't beat the price. We ate at the little sushi place next door, and it was also okay. Lots of locals in there. We'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: This is an old property that has recently changed hands and is trying to make a comeback. It's in a great location if your visiting Studio City, but there are other places in this area that offer better value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: 2ndhomeLA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are good size and very spacious. I had a pool view room which was excellent and I could relax on the balcony in the sunshine too. The swimming pool is fantastic, very clean and good facilities available with towels laid out ready for you. Perhaps they could open the pool bar a little earlier, although I may have been there out of season. The restaurant is good also, wide selection on offer and relatively cheap but there are other options close by to add a bit of variety. The gardens are lovely and there is no doubt why people would choose to have a wedding there for the gardens and walkways alone! Will definately be back the next time im in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the lodge?”
Reviews.Author: 5slags
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel on a saturday in November 2011 for one night. Our cousins had an event planned in one of the Villa rooms. The hotel gave us 20% discount since we were there for the party (thank goodness). The customer service was great and the staff were very friendly. We did not see much charm or anything suggestive of sportsmen or a lodge. I guess it used to be a Hollywood hangout. Outside the hotel were large banners noting they were newly renovated. The lobby was nice with a bar off to the left. Check in was fast. We parked in the back and entered a small corridor into the hotel. Immediately there is a musty odor of an old hotel, not necessarily smoke, and certainly not of renovations (new carpet or paint). Room 222 had queen beds which were new and comfortable. The bathroom was small but not remodeled. The towels were new and fluffy. The furniture was old and drawers were loud. We did not get to use the pool since it was winter and we did not see a hot tub. The pool is very large. Outside the hotel was nothing extraordinary and not a destination location. This was Los Angeles, a major metropolis. There was a huge levee in back of the hotel, condos, apartments, grocery strip mall, telephone wires. Essentially a hotel smack dab in the middle of the hustle and bustle of LA. The dinner served at the party was chicken teriyaki and was very good. After the party, we went to the hotel bar at 10:30pm but it was closed. We had breakfast in the hotelâ€™s cafÃ©. The meals were large and tasty, even the kids meal was huge. The hotel suited us for the night but would not have been our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation but good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Toni G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sportsmen's Lodge in late September early October of this year during me and my partners first trip to LA and found it quite convenient. It was a close walk to the shops on Ventura Boulevard and they offered a free shuttle bus to universal studios. The rooms aren't amazing but they were ok for our budget. The hotel is in need of renovation, the carpet and walls are very 80's but overall the customer service was great and the staff were very helpful. Try to avoid gettng a smoking room, they smell terrible and have the worst views. Luckily enough we were able to change to a non-smoking room after we caught sight of a number of spiders watching us from the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is convenient if you have an event right there. If nit, plenty of other places to stay. This place is very noisy. Walls a”
Reviews.Author: Ktprezioso
Reviews.Content: Charged me $11.00 to park! Why do they do that? It should have been included with room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Old school hotel with a modern vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Lennl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention at their event center. The room was nice and I was digging the balcony outside our room. The price was reasonable. The walls were paper thin but did not affect our sleep. The only negative was the event center had weddings going on and we could not bypass them to get to our event.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool, bar, cafe and a good value”
Reviews.Author: redes350
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in the Valley. Comfortable, affordable, A little rough around the edges but this adds to the charm of this well established landmark hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a quintessential southern california classic!”
Reviews.Author: Stillwater54
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, great service, we have stayed hear numerous times!

Reviews.Title: “One night with the 1st Marine Division............”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Sportsmans Lodge. It's an older place, been around over 30 years. Nice place, kept up nice. My only comment, if you're not on the top floor just cross your fingers that the room above you doesn't have kids in it. It sounded like the entire 1st Marine Division was marching through the room. The sounds are not muffled at all and I suppose it's because it's not built to the modern standards of some places today. One complaint, when we made our reservation we were told that check-in is 3pm. We arrived at 3:15 and discovered that our room was not ready yet. The place didn't look that full either. Especially when we visited the restaurant for desert around 8pm. The place looked like a ghost town. On the positive side, beds were comfortable and the room was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but functional”
Reviews.Author: cheekychubbychops
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 night and it does look very tired and dated but the rooms were fine. Good beds and linen and a great shower. What's not to like? Couldn't get a seat around pool after a long days sight seeing so that wasn't great, and we didn't eat there so can't comment on food. Definitely worth a budget short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: jazz4me
Reviews.Content: Although my reserved room was not acceptable (too musty and run down) the staff was extremely accommodating and relocated me to another room overlooking the pool and gardens. I did have to pay an additional $10/night in order to get this upgrade, however, since the base cost was very affordable this was fine with me. The Patio Cafe was good and the location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Retains some charm, but lots of negatives”
Reviews.Author: Ebart01
Reviews.Content: Good location- easy to walk to restaurants and drive around Beverly Hills. Pool area was a positive- heated and plenty of seating. Rooms were below average for the price- small with an outdated bathroom. Walls were pitifully thin, we could easily hear every neighbors' conversation, as well as "adult activity". Room was not ready at check-in time. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with some highlights”
Reviews.Author: MusicGuy
Reviews.Content: The Sportsman's Lodge has been around for a long time and it shows. The rooms and furnishings are a little old but comfortable nevertheless. Check-in was great. I had called ahead as I was delayed and would arrive well after midnight. When I got in, I was greeted by name (I must have been the only one to be coming in this late!) and they had already checked me in to make sure that I wouldn't lose my room - it was full that night. The problem is that the hotel is a popular place for weddings, celebrations, and a popular public pool. Saturday morning, the pool was packed and noisy enough to wake me up. Then, on Saturday night, the party went on till past 11pm stopping me from getting an early night. The Patio Cafe serves a decent breakfast although service can be a little slow. Some of the wait-staff seems to have been there for years, greeting regulars by name and being generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad at Sportsmen's Lodge”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: My short stay at the Sportsmen's Lodge was fair. Check-in was efficient and parking was easy. Unfortunately the hotel is very outdated, with tiny elevators and dirty carpet in the hallways. My room was nice but I had expected there would be a small refrigerator, but there was not, and ice machines are only located on the first floor, which is an inconvenience. The pool is wonderful. The business center is pathetic and the fee for using the PC in the so-called "business center" is the most grossly overpriced I have ever seen anywhere. (I could go down the street and use the PC at FedEx/Kinkos for about 35% cheaper than the ripoff fee this hotel charges.) Also, all night long I could hear people in the room above mine stomping around on their floor -- I almost expected the ceiling in my room to fall in. When I am back in the Studio City area, I doubt I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Smelly”
Reviews.Author: hawk80
Reviews.Content: The hallways smell like a convalescent home. The room did not have a smoke detector. It was ripped off the wall. Funny stains on carpet and draperies The refrigerator would not get cold. The TV was 15 yrs old. The beds were hard, The a/c struggled, the coffee pot sparked at the outlet when plugged it. The music at the pool bar lasted till 11 pm on a THURSDAY night that the sliding glass door could not stop the noise. Hauling your own luggage from the upstairs to the parking lot is a major strain as there are no ramps or elevators, Not the cheapest place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Legendary hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: martinjld
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel numerous times for business. This is a strange hotel because of the wide variety of people who "hang out" at this place. This is definitely not a very clean or modern hotel. The premises are kind of run down. The rooms are dirty, the furniture is cheap, the TVs are old, the bathrooms could use a facelift, but at least the beds are comfy. This hotel is more suited for people who just want to hang out by the pool and drink. After all the negatives about this place, it is still a legendary place to stay and hang out, and that somehow makes up for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Too many inconsistancies with website”
Reviews.Author: Nan V
Reviews.Content: We made reservations online. The website showed a workout room, of which there was none. It also stated that there was a refrigerator in every room, of which there was none. The website NEEDS to be updated for me to return. The room was to be non-smoking, but was in a wing that had been smoking in the past. I have respiratory problems which were aggravated. We ate in the cafe 5 times. The food was very good, however was not served hot on the weekend. The pool was a nice facility and heated for morning use. Rooms were clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice place with a personality”
Reviews.Author: Bandon37
Reviews.Content: Those that don't like this place need to stay in their cookie cutter hotels. This place is really nice. OK the carpets are older but everything is clean. The rooms are nice with great AC. The pool is fantastic. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in LA.”
Reviews.Author: MisterMVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before about 4 years ago. It has a very nice (and large) pool area. We enjoyed sitting around it and swimming in it after a very long drive from Arizona. Our room was pool facing and very convenient. Everything was clean. My only issue with this hotel is that the room doesn't have a refrigerator, something I would expect here. I noted this last time we were here as well. This is not a five star hotel by any stretch of the imaginiation but it's very comfortable and a very good value. It looks like it's recently changed hands. It probably needs some upkeep but it's in reasonably good shape. It's also well situated near many sites including Hollywood, Griffith Park, and Universal Studios. There are many eateries and two grocery stores along Ventura Boulevard. We ate a City Wok about a mile or two up the street in the direction of Universal Studios and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Studio City, CA!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barbaram612
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Sportsmen in Studio City. It has an amazing swimming pool, great food, very nice staff. The front desk was very nice and accomodating..even checked us in before our check-in time. Room was very nice, little out dated but reasonable priced. The bathroom was very small and the room had very thin walls. Overall, I enjoyed my stay (stayed for 10 days). Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when they told me that they where not able to give me a room in the upper floor because they were sold out and that I was the latest to arrive ... it was only 5 o'clock. I did my reservation almost 2 months in advance and I reserve for an executive room, but it's not what I've got. They tried to convince me that the room was what I reserved and they charge me the price of an executive room. I even spoke with the manager, but nothing to do. He said that he will try to move me the next day, but nothing was sure. I show him the reservation with all the informations of the website, the definition of the executive room : supposed to be a renovated room, floor between 2 and 5, king bed, pool view, etc. But the manager keep telling me that he gave me an executive room. They put me in the motel section, 1st floor, view on the trees, 2 double beds, an old style room. The room was paper thin, I could hear my neighbor talking. We were supposed to stay 4 nights but after one night we move to another hotel. They didn't not ask why we left after only 1 night. The only positive point is the breakfast in the room. We knew we would move to another hotel so we woke-up earlier. The breakfast was good and right on time.

Reviews.Title: “It fits our needs”
Reviews.Author: grandmajoanie6602
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the hotel because it fits our needs in that we visit our family who lives in Studio City and it's convenient and close. The hotel room is clean. The staff accommodating. We enjoyed bringing our family for a day at the pool with poolside lunch.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back to Sportsmen's lodge Hotel and never recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Iolanda S
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel an hour early to maybe enjoy the pool like we do when we go away. There is nothing like being on vacation and sitting by the pool with a nice cold drink. We were looking forward to relaxing for the weekend. Unfortunately, that was not the case at the Sportsmen's Lodge. We were never informed that the pool was a public pool! It was hard to find a chair to sit in and the pool was crowded, nothing relaxing about that. The service was awful, the waitress was not only slow but couldn't understand our food or drink order. It took her 20 minutes to understand what we wanted then another 10 minutes to put it in the computer only to put it in wrong and another 20 minutes to fix the problem. Not only could she not back -up the bartender, there was only one bartender who was great but constantly leaving the bar to deliver food to the pool area. We waited two hours for our food then another hour for our check. When we went up just for drinks we waited an hour so we would each order two drinks only to have them get hot in the sun otherwise it would be another two hours before we got another one! That was only Saturday! On Sunday morning we decided we would eat in the cafe, food was ok but again 2 hours to get food and there were only two other tables in our area. We started our day early, by 10am the pool was filled with what we named "the bracelet people" again no place to sit and no towels. We were there for a wedding so we all together had about 15 rooms. We were also told the hotel was sold out, so why would you have public swimming at your pool when your hotel is sold out and no where for your paying guests to relax or swim. We had one table and two lounge chairs between 20 of us because there was no other place to sit, we had to alternate who sat and who stood. We even had a person come sit in the middle of our group! I had two rooms in the hotel and that is not what I paid for! In all my years of traveling (34 yrs) I have never seen anything like this! On Monday morning we checkout early and ate breakfast elsewhere. Your hotel is poorly managed! I would have put a sign up a month before that the pool would not be open to the public that weekend because the hotel was full. I think if it was not for the convenience of the banquet hall next door you would not have the amount of guests staying in your hotel. I know that when I come out again and it is for a wedding there, I will not stay at your hotel. I will drive the extra time it takes to stay elsewhere. When we checked out we were asked how was the wedding, we said "great". And then we were asked how was our stay and we said "Not so great", we were never asked why it was not great and what was wrong with our stay. Again poor management! I did learn one thing and that is from now on I have to ask a hotel if they have public swimming so that I do not book there. I hope you can now understand why we will not be staying there the next time we are in town

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: maureenpudlo
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation 7 months in advance and asked for ground floor pool view so I could walk in and out of my room from the pool. We got there, room was not ready until 3:30pm I got a pool view on the ground BUT the gate was locked. After 10 phone calls and being told "we will have someone come by an unlock it) I finally got the truth- we were at the end and it was locked for a safety reason. No other rooms were available. Needless to say, this was very disapointing and a ruin to a 5 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, secure and reliable - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowWeegie
Reviews.Content: Room was of a good standard and very clean. Yes there are areas that could be updated but it all works and is spotless. The staff were all friendly and helpful. No fridge in the room but when requested was put in the room within 10 minutes. Room service also very good. The pool is an excellent size and very warm and welcoming. The area the hotel is located in is easy to walk around with a supermarket opposite and many restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely recommend Twains on the corner for breakfast. A real old diner with great value food and friendly staff as well as locals. Make use of the shuttle from the hotel to universal soooo much easier than driving yourself. We will certainly stay at the Sportsman's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: 123Cooper
Reviews.Content: Great location in Los Angeles, near all the main sights. Rooms were clean and tidy. If in a room of four you would have two large beds which you share and are big enough. We many not have had a great view but the room was all you need, clean,comfortable, tidy, large and balcony. The pool was clean and lit up at night and also had an outdoor jaccuzi around the back. If you stay here the night time food is not great but if you want to visit LA why not eat out? The hotel must not be that bad if it was used to film an episode of 'the office' and season 2 episode remember (1) here. When I visited the sportsmans lodge had just had the lobby redecorated. The hotel is quiet and has a big supermarket across the road. Doors locked fine and were safe, there is also a lift here if you need it.From this hotel we visited - Universal studios, Hollywood - the stars and famous handprints - Rhodeo drive - Beverly hills- Venice muscle beach and santa monica pier. Did not get a chance to roam around the lodge very much but hear there is a nice gardens. Overall, the room is great for a shower and sleep at night and to explore throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth what I paid”
Reviews.Author: BTrip028
Reviews.Content: The rooms were paper thin, lots of partys going on until early morning hours in the hotel and around the pool even though the pool states it closes at 9:00PM. No cafe until Thursday for dinner, their cafe is not open throughout week and when it is open it closes at 2:00PM and does not reopen. You could hear people in the rooms next to you and above you. Actual conversations. People in the hallways slamming doors, laughing and partying. Not only do you pay for your room but have to pay to park your car in their parking lot $11 per day. You are charged a $250 deposit so in case you smoke in the room they charge you a cleaning fee. Even if you did not smoke it takes over a week for them to credit back your card. They state it is done at check out but do not plan on seeing the credit for up to 2 weeks. I still have not seem mine.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: EducatorMarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to try to beat the heat, as they have a large swimming pool. The pool area was very loud, like they are trying to create a party scene. My children did enjoy the swimming, but did not enjoy the loud music and too many people everywhere. The pool towels were gross, very hard to find a clean one. The room was yucky smelling. Bed was decently comfortable, but sheets had holes in them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dmcneil127
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is a bit dated, but the retro decor is fun and funky. The bed was heavenly! New down-like lite comforter and thick, soft pillows. The pool area is happening on weekends. It is close to everything and convenient. Best of all, as a woman traveling alone, I always felt safe there. I was a bit put off by the $10.00 a night parking fee, but it seems to be common in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinodn76
Reviews.Content: This is an above average hotel. The staff is couteous and helpful. This is a very large property in LA. The rooms are oldish and the accessories are also old. Food taste was okay. The location is good. You have lots of options of restaurants outside like - Subway, Star Bucks, Big Mama's Pizza etc. Overall experience of staying for 1 & 1/2 days is nothing great.

Reviews.Title: “the put me out in the street with a child”
Reviews.Author: cathasson
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation thru the hotels website and had the confirmation letter in my HAND on my ipad. We came all the way from NC, traveled all day only to be told "your reservation was cancelled". The unemotional, cold front desk person would not tell me how or why. I did not cancel it so who did. He offered me a smoking room but we have asthma so that is not a good thing. I mentioned that it did not appear they were booked solid since the large parking lots were empty. He said there were tour buses. I went back there to check after we found another hotel and ate dinner. NO BUSES at 9pm. I have to say that after seeing and smelling the lobby I did not regret not staying there. It smelled bad and looked really dirty and in disrepair. There is something wrong at this hotel. In case there is a need for my proof of this here is my confirmation # 136616503

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Powle
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our time at the poolside bar - bartender "Joe" was not only fun to talk with but he fixed a great drink. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant and were pleasantly surprised by not only great food but friendly fun service!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one or two nights, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Natasja1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 2 nights of a 3 week tour through California & Nevada. We had a rental car and were able to get to most of the interesting sites within 30 minutes. Getting around without a car I think can be difficult. The room was large though it could have done with some updating, with large & comfortable beds.. Checking in & out went fine and there was plenty of space to park the car (note, there's a charge!) There was a nice big pool but as we came to see the city we didn't have the chance to use it. Looked nice & clean though. What we did notice was that there was fairly loud music playing in the pool area, and that music was on until at least 10pm. Our room was in a corridor away from the room so luckily it didn't bother us. There's a restaurant on site and the food was very nice. Huge portions! Service in the restaurant was a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your valuables and I hope your are not hungry!”
Reviews.Author: marcdenari
Reviews.Content: Regretfully my wife and I had business in Sherman Oaks and chose to stay at the "Sportsman's Lodge Hotel". Not regretting the business, that went well but staying at this hotel was less than desired. We checked in about 9pm and that went just fine. I love old movies but this place reminded me of the lodge in the movie "Dirty Dancing" staring Patrick Swayze & Jennifer Grey set in the 60's. The place smelled a bit old and was very noisy at night. The next morning our appointment nearby was at 9am and that was 5 minutes away so at 8am we went downstairs to the restaurant and were immediately seated. My wife ordered an omelet while I'm a sucker for biscuits and gravy. Her meal looked great while the cook told our waiter someone forgot to make the biscuits. I said that was fine bring me some toast and we'll cover it with their "homemade" gravy. They brought me toast and a container that held 2 tablespoons of gravy!!!!! I said is this a joke or a teaser? The waiter said this is how they serve it but let me get you another container of gravy. Yes another 2 tablespoons! Appalling! Now here's the best part. We left and forgot my wife's pajamas hanging on the bathroom door and called the hotel. I spoke with 3 different people on the phone over several hours and although all 3 promised to call me back after they checked with the manager, housekeeping supervisor and the maid who cleaned our room we still have not been contacted yet and that's been a week. The pajamas were a gift, not an heirloom but just a few hours after we left they could't locate the maid or housekeeping supervisor so one would wonder if the employees are taking things out of the rooms while people are still there? Sad very sad that we called 3 times and after being promised a call back we still haven't heard from anyone at this hotel! Personally I would rather drive 100 miles than stay at this place ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Problematic stay”
Reviews.Author: elizaminerva
Reviews.Content: We knew that Sportsmen's Lodge would be a green haven in the middle of busy Ventura Boulevard, but we didn't anticipate the disruption of events planned and unplanned: a wedding reception that careened loudly into the early hours of the morning, and a thunderous two-day rain that drenched much of the lobby and outdoors and caused the public areas to fill up, literally, with furniture in various stages of drying. Our first room, right beside the first floor exit, was intolerably noisy (the wedding? normal traffic? who knows), and at our request we were cheerfully switched to a 3rd floor room that was quite comfortable. There was free internet and the staff was friendly and supportive, but next time we'll stay at the Beverly Garland Holiday Inn, where such surprises are few.

Reviews.Title: “Above average - great location”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Limerick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - close to Universal Studio and Beverly Hills. It' is clean & comfortable, so in our opinion it was great value. I can't say I felt 100% comfortable with the flimsy lock on the patio door, but we had no problems security wise. Nor was there any safe in our room. There was free (albeit slow) WIFI, and a good shower. House-keeping also did an excellent job every day. Parking was $11 per day. Overall, for the price we paid, we were very happy as we only used the room to sleep and shower while we explored L.A.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean”
Reviews.Author: KimStrayer19
Reviews.Content: The pool was so warm it was terrific. The room was clean but bathroom was a little small & outdated. The on site restaurant was great & all the food we had was good. Don't care for the hold that gets put on your credit card.Especially since they had been paid & 9 days later the hold was released. Nor the 3 calls after check out to get my 25.00 food credit applied to my account.

Reviews.Title: “Really Fun”
Reviews.Author: SteveDson
Reviews.Content: I lived in LA for years and was always obsessed with the Sportsmen's Lodge every time I would pass by, so this May when I returned to LA for a wedding my wife and I decided to stay here (the price was definitely right). What a great hotel (it's not the four season's but we already know that) Our room, a poolside king, was enormous, and needless to say clean, being able to sit out on the private patio and drink coffee in the morning was wonderful. And the restaurant had really fantastic breakfasts - I mean really good breakfasts - If I still lived in LA I would go there (Hat tip to Moe - our favorite waiter). We also enjoyed the giant pool - which has a decidedly old California feel too it - with people actually laying out in the sun and ordering drinks from the bartender. Most of our activities took us to Hollywood and or Downtown and it was very convenient for both. The downside would be that on Saturday they rented the pool area to birthday party with a DJ who blasted music and when we returned late Saturday afternoon to relax before going out again it was a little loud.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: 99times
Reviews.Content: The website and lobby prepare you for a great place. Once you get in the room, however, you realize the updates haven't extended that far. But the bed was very good, the bathroom was clean (not so the room corners or balcony), and the pool was great and well heated. It just felt like we were staying in a roadside motel in the '80s - and right next to the elevators, which were grinding away all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DanaSC
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. There is nothing fancy about it but it is clean and comfortable. The lobby area is nice to hang out with friends. They have a nice pool and the staff is great. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant but it was fresh and very good. Would stay here again next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilipNelson
Reviews.Content: Sportsmans Lodge is a Hollywood Icon. All of the Hollywood legends have stayed here. With recent updates, you won't find a better value near Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “All great except one downer which spoiled the whole party”
Reviews.Author: Intimidated
Reviews.Content: So, let me start off by saying that this hotel is really great for anyone who doesn't care about staying "connected" - so if internet access isn't important to you, read another review. Upon arriving at the hotel, the wifi was broken. A call to the "tech support" department of the hotel was fruitless; they told me there's nothing they can do and they will send up a technician (which they never did). After some hunting around I found the ADSL router in the room (yeah, really.. some borked internal DSLams or something) and cycled the power, which restored service. What was the real big issue though was the speed. The room advertised "high speed internet" but the actual speed never peaked above 0.2 mbit (which isn't even enough to play youtube video at the lowest quality), with dropouts and massive packet loss. The technical support department, again, did nothing to help. The net is free, granted, but given that it was completely unusable, i'd have much preferred to have paid for a decent service. We were in room 510 right at the top of the building, so the length and quality of the phone line might have been the problem! (Why don't they just use Ethernet like everyone else?!)

Reviews.Title: “Always the best”
Reviews.Author: LRohn
Reviews.Content: I refuse to stay anywhere but the Sportsmen's Lodge when I visit LA. Its close to my family, and shopping. For this New Yorker who doesnt drive, that is KEY! I can literally walk to my cousins place on Ventura. The staff is always welcoming and super friendly, they treat you as if you were family. And the waitress in the Patio cafe always remembers me from my last visit. I try to get out to visit LA 2-3 times a year and I have to admit that sometimes that 3rd visit is strictly for the AMAZING POOL. They are also very interacive with their social networking. I posted a comment on their Facebook page and received 3 comments back within a couple of hours. It shows there is someone listening, not just speaking. :-) LOVE IT!!! I will definitely be back in August..I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Great in Pictures”
Reviews.Author: soccerjock310
Reviews.Content: Wow!, I've stayed here twice in the past month. First, there are better priced hotels. This is a family hotel or more a hotel for senior citizens. The photos give the impression that its this trendy Hollywood hotel in Studio city. Get over it real quick. The carpet is dated in the halls and rather than place it they just steam decades of cigarette smoke and what ever out leaving a constant stench in the hallways. There's literally 20 shades of floral wall paper all over the place, the rooms look more like a Florida condo rental, the room service is horrible and way over priced, and the service makes you feel like you're standing in line at KMart. Let me why. I was standing in line in the lobby at the front desk when a girl behind the desk yelled out, "I can help the next customer in line". Need I say any more. Bottom line, this is an over priced hotel with a staff that has no idea what real "hotel' guest services are.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing break!”
Reviews.Author: crisrealty
Reviews.Content: This is a great place tucked into the middle of everything. The bed was soooo comfortable. Great view overlooking the pool. Staff was really friendly and helpful! Perfect setting to tour the area or to have a quiet place away from it all. recommended to me by a movie star friend, this is the "Best secret in town!" A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, easy place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JanTanton
Reviews.Content: Very clean in our room - great bed to sleep in. In fact, I would say that it's the best hotel night's sleep that I've ever had away from home. Loved the nice high pressure showers (one of my "must - have's". Pricing was good - we booked well in advance so that we could get a decent rate. We would stay here again when we have business in the valley. It's not fancy, but for the price, it was great. People were friendly. Hotel recommended B & W Limo as transfer to and from the airports. They were great, and I would recommend them again too!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, comfortable and courteous-- great value!”
Reviews.Author: MarieTheAmazon
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sportsmen's Lodge as the most convenient place to stay for our friends' wedding this month; the ceremony and reception were both at the Event Center next door. The grounds were lovely for the wedding, and we found the location to be excellently sited for all we were doing for the weekend. The rooms are frankly just a touch worn in a spot or two, but they were spotlessly clean each of the four days we stayed, and we always felt safe -- both VERY important to us, much more so than up-to-the-second decor, and we consider that to be the biggest contributions to the great value! And the mattress and bedding were soooooo comfortable.... Wonderful! Even after we had left, when I realized I had left one item behind and called from the road to have it sent, Jose at the front desk was great and had it shipped to me immediately. Clean, convenient, comfortable and courteous: I'd definitely stay here again with no question!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Greyhound38
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was comfortable and convenient, the rooms were pretty dated. The balcony of my room and the next one to it had a secondary fence to prevent anyone from falling through the original rotting railing that was still in place. There was no mini bar in the room. The public areas were ok and had obviously been upgraded. The staff was friendly and efficient in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was too small”
Reviews.Author: gordondb
Reviews.Content: The Sportsmen's Lodge is a throwback to the old days when the Valley was not wall-to-wall houses and strip malls. Usually, the accommodations are great, but this time we were put in the old wing. Although we were supposed to have a king bed, it was probably only fullsize, not even a Queen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BabyDocMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of a friend's wedding, usually stay at a chain. Surprised by friendliness of staff and comfort of bed and linen. Got a great night's sleep, which is all that matters to me. Very reasonably priced for the comfort and cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, Lots of Character but.....”
Reviews.Author: decogirl
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for my kids nomination for the Young Artist Awards in March. We choose this hotel because the event was at the Sportsman Lodge so it was convenient. The hotel was charming, the staff was very pleasant, the garden was beautiful. But the room we were initially given on the 2nd floor was not too clean. We walked into the room and the carpet had stains by the door, but that was not the doozer, my husband saw a bed bug crawling around the bed sheet and I immediately called down to the front desk and ask for another room. We were given a room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool :) I guess the bedbug landed us a better room. The 2nd room was fine, no bedbugs! We checked by pulling the bedsheets off and checking around the mattress seams! Yuck! Other then that, it was a pleasant stay. Plus my daughter won an acting award for her catagory! I can't recommend this hotel because of the bedbugs, sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: EricParkinson1
Reviews.Content: Prime location, clean rooms, very nice layout and green-spaces and good value for room. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: noslengnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights as part of a nearby conference at the CBS Studio Center. Sportsmen's Lodge was conveniently located with lots of nearby places within walking distance. Check-in was smooth and staff was friendly and the room was clean and spacious (a king sized bed). Bathroom was very clean, to me the sign of a well-kept place. Plenty of parking available in front, side and back. Room was quiet enough to sleep although I tend to be a pretty sound sleeper. While I was awake, I could hear people in the hallway who were talking but at night it was quiet. Also, free wireless internet was available so that was a nice surprise. The web site didn't really point out that so I was assuming it was only available for a fee so I was pleasantly surprised. Overall, a great place to stay after a long day out at a conference. I think in the future I may try to stay with family as there is a free shuttle to and from Universal Studios Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine123456789
Reviews.Content: VERY nice pool and gardens. Large rooms. Old building with good soundproofing. Front desk staff seem overworked and understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: jekkajai
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for us since our conference was on site. You have to pay for parking which for me has always been a con when it comes to any hotel, but it was $11 per night which wasn't to exhorbitant. The hotel had a very retro feeling to it. The pool was heated and they did provide hair dryers in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the decor in the room was suitable. Lobby and hallway decor made the hotel feel very dated and I felt like I was in 1960's Hollywood. The conference room was pretty and the other grounds (which I didn't know existed until I went to the conference room) were very picturesque. They have very nice waterfalls and streams which seems separated from the main hotel and like a completely different place. We did eat in the hotel restaurant. The food was very tasty but the wait was just unacceptable. Our conference broke for lunch and we had an hour and fifteen minutes to eat. For the first fifteen minutes we didn't even get menus and after getting menus it took another fifteen to twenty minutes to place an order. The food is cooked to order, but considering we ordered hamburgers, it took about half an hour to get two burgers. Needless to say we came back late from lunch. The doors slam very loudly so when you're sleeping, you might awaken to these loud slams and in the morning, if you want to sleep in, it would be difficult to do so because you can hear the plumbing through the walls when everyone was taking a shower. Overall it was an ok stay for a night or two,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sparkleali7
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Sportsmen's Lodge and highly recommend it to other travelers. The restaurant was one of the best I've eaten at. The food was outstanding, but the service was quite slow and they seemed consistently understaffed. (The food was still worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “A Trip Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: DavidLibby
Reviews.Content: The Sportmen's Lodge takes me back in time, though the accommodations have been upgraded since I attended many Bar Mitzvahs there back in the day. We really had a great stay, overall. The food at the restaurant is good. If I stayed there again I would check in earlier in the day, stay on the outside of the hotel, not facing the pool (away from the people who smoke outside the restaurant) and take the kids to the pool. It would also be a great place to have an event. My 7 year old told me she wants to get married there. So cute.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: FMan81
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of places in the Los Angeles area and the Sportsman's Lodge is my favorite for the price. With an advance booking, I was able to get a room for less than $100 a night and the property is outstanding for that price. The facility is a little old. The rooms don't have flat screens and they feel a little dated. But that doesn't bother me. I'm more about location and cleanliness, and the Sportsman's Lodge is in a great Studio City neighborhood and the place is extremely well kept. Also, the grounds are absolutely beautiful. The pool area is nice and all outdoor areas are great. In short, if you're just looking for a nice, quiet place to stay and don't require a flat screen TV and a room that looks like it was decorated yesterday, you'll love the Sportsman's Lodge. As long as the price range stays similar, I plan to return later this year when I take the family to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem, Central Location, Great Value for SoCal $”
Reviews.Author: Gigi1310
Reviews.Content: Ambiance is a throwback to California in the late 50's/early 60's. Balcony off of our room overlooking Koi pond, great gardens and pool area. Great Tapas in the bar and wonderful breakfast in the red and white "tuck and roll" banquettes in the cafe. Stayed in several locations and would stay here as central location for all LA activities if I had it to do over again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying experience.”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler099
Reviews.Content: I am traveling with my family relocating to L.A. and lost my credit card. I prepaid two nights on hot wire before losing card. The hotel would not check me in told me I needed a $250 deposit for the room forcing me and my wife and child to sleep in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with all the necessary conveniences”
Reviews.Author: Haystack47
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and very helpful Restaurant personnel are excellent Breakfast food very good Bathrooms are on the small size relative to other experiences Entire facility kept very clean, including room. Wife arrived ahead of me and needed a room change because of a noisy first floor location. We are repeat customers

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bhermann
Reviews.Content: We went for thanksgiving at my fiance's parents house. We where with in walking distance of everything we needed includeing Her parents house. Ventura blvd. is nice in this area and good restaraunts too. All of this was important as they charge $11 a day for parking. Something to keep in mind as parking in this area is not the best. Room decore was spars but very large for its size. Rooms were clean but not 4 star hotel clean. Clearly renovations from years of neglect was still in work. As for bring children would be fine but keep an eye on them at all times as there is plenty of trouble to get into given the renovations or lack ther of. I did not see a security gaurd to speek of but felt pretty safe given that the area is safe by Los Angales standards. Keep your gaurd up at all times I say, and again don't let those kids wonder off by them selves.

Reviews.Title: “great place for mom and dad to stay when in town”
Reviews.Author: julesbell
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Sportsman's to me several years ago; it has some good olf Hollywood history- still, supposedly, the place that celebs come when they want to beon the down-low. if the walls could talk... It's clean, the rooms are decent-sized. I've never been in one without a nice view and my parents and friend's parents have made several visits over the years. And- it's old-school hotel-land- which I love. There's a little bar in the quaint lobby (love the check-in desk),a cafe with a patio, outdoor pool (is theated? dont know) and a jacuzzi--whiiich-- doesnt' always work. Fun to stroll around- thee's a garden near the pooll. Convenient to everything. Stay. But only tell people who will appreciate and respect its charm about the place. :)

Reviews.Title: “Classic gem”
Reviews.Author: cd_stanley
Reviews.Content: Updated rooms, comfortable and affordable, excellence service, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Srsignore
Reviews.Content: Sportsman Lodge is a very nice hotel at a reasonable price. The rooms are spacious, the pool was wonderful, and the restaurant was very good. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stellaloo
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel to LA, which is often, we always stay at the Sportsmen's. The choices in this area of LA are few, and for the money, we great a great room with a balcony overlooking the pool, and the hotel is small enough so our teenagers can go up to the room themselves without getting lost in a huge complex. Also, since the renovation, the lobby and public areas are wonderful. I think the pool could use some new chairs, though! We love the coffee shop too!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: er5989a
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge while in town for business. Everything about the hotel is just ok. It has very outdated decor and facilities but it is certainly livable if you are only staying a few days. The room was generally clean but we did find a roach in the bathroom, which did not seem to surprise the people at the front desk. The walls between rooms must be paper thin as normal conversations were audible from the next room and hallway. The "rental facility" associated with the hotel states that it has been recently renovated but you could have fooled me. The landscaping around the facility consists of a very dirty brook and fountain. The Wi-Fi is free in the rooms but the charges to use the outdated and slow computers in the business center are ridiculous. The redeeming quality of this hotel is its location and friendly staff. Although there is not transportation to or from LAX it is right across from a grocery store and minutes for the studios. The staff in the cafÃ© and front desk were all helpful and upbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: birdie
Reviews.Content: A good value for money hotel ,Good on site restraunt and lots of eating places within a short walking distance Supermarket turn right out of main gate and across road at next road junction. Lovley pool on site with outside bar. The free shuttle to Universal Studios is a big plus just book in advance at reception giving the time you want to go and time you want to return. Free Safety Deposit Boxes at Reception just give your room number. Some people want 5 star fpr a 3 star price this is a good quality solid 3 star property and if you go expecting a 3 star hotel then you will get exactly that and I am sure you will have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: imbsweet54
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the SLH was as pleasant as the first, (6/10). We choose this location because of it's proximity our daughter's home. Once again we found staff and accomodations to be above expectations. Although the Lodge is an older property and showing signs of age, it is clean and the rooms have always been very clean and comfortable. Our flight into LA had us arriving well after 10:00 PM, yet we found the staff to be welcoming and friendly. We had booked the studio suite poolside, and found it to be quite roomy with a couch and chair/ottoman. Windows lined one wall with views of the pool and the hills across Ventura. We noted when we got to the room, that the refrigerator was not there as had been the expectation..a call to the front desk brought an attendant with the fridge within 15 minutes! We also received exceptional service from housekeeping staff, pool bar, and Cafe staff! I have even observed maintenance staff working to clean around the pool and parking lot areas well into the evening. The price of the rooms seems to be reasonable for the area. The only suggestion I might make is to possibly update and spruce up the hallways a bit, and to repair the balcony railings as they were very wobbly, and I would be a bit worried about the safety issues!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: pdiddy26
Reviews.Content: Room was not as expected. Ordered a suite and what they call a suite is not more than a one room (small at the very best) with a bed, desk and couch. Ice is only found on the first floor. Very old building, screens were bent. The room for our reunion was exceptional but would never recommend anyone stay at this hotel again. The Days Inn across the street for $79 was bigger and better than the $150 I paid for a nothing suite.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: strotta11
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Sportsmen's Lodge. I booked it because it was close to Universal Studios, the room included the tickets, and it was a great value. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived to see a nice, big, cozy room overlooking the pool. The bed was comfortable. We had a refrigerator and in-room movies. What more could you ask for? The only thing that was unpleasant is that one of the guys in the restaurant lied to us when he said he didn't have vanilla ice cream. We had walked into the restaurant after being at the park all day and just wanted some vanilla ice cream to take up to our room. He said they didn't have any but the room service menu listed pie alamode so we ordered it through room service and they had it. The same guy brought it up so he realized he was just caught in a lie. He gave us extra ice cream and apologized.

Reviews.Title: “Good & disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: TAMSTER106
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and have never had a problem, thus the reason I returned. The staff in the Patio Cafe were great!! The room was clean and the staff (front desk excluded) was extremely nice. I did have a problem with my room key. Three times I had to get a new key and was blamed each time for it not working. My room had no refrigerator and I contacted the front desk twice with no results. Also, and my biggest complaint......I had requested a room with a pool view (an additional $10 per night.) I did get a room on the pool side, however, my balcony was boarded up so that you could not see out. Seems the original railing was so rotted that for safety reasons boarding was placed. So sitting on the balcony, my view consisted of....... nothing. Upon check out I asked to be credited the $30 for my non-existent pool view. I was told the room was on the pool side, deal with it. Granted it was only $30 and at the very least an apology for the misunderstanding should have taken place. The woman's attitude at the front desk was callous at best. She showed very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: FawnCaldwell
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, clean and had no added fragrances. The view was great and it was quiet. The bed/mattress was very comfortable. Had a nice desk for the computer and even a refrigerator. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Could be jewel but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Juretennis1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within 10-20 min to all the top spots in Hollywood, Beverly Hills etc. it is a smaller hotel, rooms are small for 4 people, especially the bathrooms are very tiny. The pool is large, the jacuzzi as well.The main problems is the missing enthusiasm of the staff. Around the pool it could last hours until garbage, and used plates are taken care of. Leaves of the tree were continuously falling down but I only saw once a person who fixed that. The restaurant is ok, but also here one has to ask for everything by oneself, nobody is taking care about the guest by himself. The hotel needs urgently restauration. If sombody wants to invest and is keen to make something out of it. I would consider this one really as a hidden jewel, based on the locationnd and the style which is so different from the usual hotel chains

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Laid-back stay.”
Reviews.Author: drsean
Reviews.Content: We took our 8 year old to see Universal Studios and we stayed here for 2 nights. We arrived unexpectedly early and the front desk staff were very accommodating. I had booked a suite package with Universal Studios tickets and the hotel breakfast. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Universal. I had read the reviews regarding the physical condition of the hotel. Yes, there were some lived-in general wear and tear cosmetic things such as the balcony railing in need of a good sanding and paint, but I felt that there were so many positives to staying here that it only added some charm to the place. The balcony was huge and it overlooked the pool. We ordered room service one night and it arrived extremely fast! It was reasonably priced and everything was delicious. The pool was huge and provided the focal point for us to relax and enjoy our stay. We used the laundry facilities as well. What really stood out for me was the staff. Genuine service with a relaxed and can-do attitude. My loyalty to this hotel was solidified when they found our towel (that had been inadvertently picked up by the pool staff for laundry) and couriered it to our next hotel in San Diego. Staff member Gabby even followed-up with a phone call to ensure I received it! Wow. Thank you Sportsman's Lodge for a memorable vacation stay just like it is supposed to be! Sincerely, Dr. Sean, Victoria, BC, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: MLK9999
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sportsmen's Lodge for years when I visit Los Angeles because the central location makes it very convenient to both sides of town. They have upgraded some things like the bed linen which is an improvement. My problem was with the carpeting not being clean, and the furniture was just okay and arranged in a haphazard way. No real style to the king bed room.

Reviews.Title: “An older hotel but..............”
Reviews.Author: sunnysandi
Reviews.Content: Yes, as already stated in so many other reviews, this is an older hotel. However, from our personal first time experience, for the rate we paid we found this hotel to be a good choice for visiting the areas many attractions. Our room was clean, the fridge looked new and was very handy.Bathroom was a little small, but this didn't bother us! There is a lovely large pool area, which never seemed to get too crowded. We found the reception staff friendly and helpful with our enquiries, and we had breakfast every morning in the restaurant and our server was always cheerful and attentive. The Sportsmens Lodge ran a free bus to Universal Studios, and we found this reliable. Based on our experiences this trip, we would stay again when visiting Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Not like we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Jaelle_53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Sportsmen's Lodge in Studio City. We booked this hotel without reading reviews as we had previously stayed here with our children but that was ten years ago. The pool is still fabulous and we enjoyed our breakfasts in the cafe as well as poolside service. The room seemed so tired and outdated. The carpet was an unusual colour - perhaps faded green? Definitely needs to be replaced! We had an adjoining room (big mistake I know!) and it was fine for the first two nights but the third night we could hear the other family's conversations loud and clear. There wasn't much on tv tho so it was rather entertaining : ) Staff was friendly and helpful although we did have to explain that CAA is the same as AAA so that we didn't pay the parking fee. We had no internet connection during our entire visit and when my husband called for tech support he was basically told it was our ipad. We found that hard to believe as we overheard other guests saying they also had no access. The free shuttle to Universal and the fabulous pool almost make up for the dowdy room. Almost.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sandysu58
Reviews.Content: We had a large comfortable room with a balcony overlooking the garden. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. After our previous trip to the USA we were surprised and pleased to see a fridge in the room. The swimming pool is just glorious - huge and really well maintained. The only downside was a bit too much noise from other rooms - stomping of feet from above and slamming of doors from the room beside us. Hard to tell if this would always be a problem or if we were just unlucky with our neighbours!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lassie1970
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and the bathroom clean. It took a while whenever I had to deal with Reception, mainly waiting in line but this means of course that when your turn came, you were never rushed. They were friendly and helpful, arranging tours and providing local information. There is a coin operated laundry which was an absolute godsend, although there was no change machine within which meant you had to go and cue back at reception to get change. The pool was the central (surrounded on all sides by the hotel) and large with a pool bar and snacks. The restaurant had strange opening times (open for breakfast but not dinner) but did a good breakfast and room service was reasonable and prompt. Very centrally located in Studio City and no problems with parking.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Place”
Reviews.Author: kmjimenez
Reviews.Content: I got bitten by bed bugs (diagnosed by a doctor) and had $100 of new make up stolen from my room. It may have been a place for stars to stay in the past but not now!

Reviews.Title: “Needs major rebuild”
Reviews.Author: leosfo
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a Suite (whatever that is nowadays- a room with a coffee table and 2 extra tables), smelled strong of paint thinner/acetone, complained, moved to room originally booked no smell. bath faucet will not stop leaking, worn out fixtures, scratched furniture, sign on balcony- (do not lean on handrail (!?!?!?), broken divider between patio's, very run down, this could be such a cool boutique hip Hollywood type place if they would fork out about 22 million, or bulldoze it and put a Residence Inn. I think it is just a mill for out of country tourists that are to far from home to complain or don't know any better.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nothing like the pictures on the Web site.”
Reviews.Author: kh1234
Reviews.Content: Basic, no frills hotel. In room amenities aren't the best - no conditioner! However, as there are limited hotels to choose from in the area, the location makes it a good option. Kids would probably love it as there is a nice size pool. Beware, the pictures make the rooms look much more luxurious than they are.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good breakfast, little expensive”
Reviews.Author: JetReviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a friend for 4 nights. Received good room service. Our room was non-smoking. Complimentary breakfast was nice. For the price we paid would have liked free internet too but that was not the case. Location was very central I would say to all 'touristy' places we wanted to visit. There were many restaurants nearby to eat at. My review title summarizes the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill Fast”
Reviews.Author: okshort
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the years, but this is the last! New ownership has made it uncharming, and maintenance is lagging. Paint is chipped on the balcony rails, dry rot painted over in the bathrooms, housekeeping is unreliable, trash carts and trash trucks run just outside the rooms late late at night and early in the morning making uninterrupted sleep impossible. The new lobby decoration is 1960's tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no communication within the staff.”
Reviews.Author: megandm10
Reviews.Content: I could tell that the staff didn't have good communication. I was happy to know that they had a shuttle service to Universal Studios. We told them the times we wanted to leave and be picked up and no one had a clue. We ended up leaving 25 minutes late and the driver was sort or wreckless.When it was time to leave the park, my boyfriend and I rushed to the pick up area to be there on time for the driver. 10 minutes later I called the hotel to see if anyone was even coming to get us. "Oh, are you suppose to be picked up right now?" No one had a clue. So we sat in the sun for 20 minutes till finally someone came to get us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: birch22
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, clean and tidy. Friendly staff and great pool. The only thing about this hotle was that we wanted to eat in the restaurant in the evening, but it clossed at 2pm, only for you to eat in your room until 10pm! We dont want to eat in our room!! But overall, great location for Universal Sytudios etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hershkel
Reviews.Content: I lived very close to Sportsmens Lodge and was in town taking care of some things. The hotel could use some updating for sure, but I like the location and it's just been around for so long, I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: NYCtype
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for years and it looks it. The rooms and public areas are right out of the sixties. And not in aq positive way. Clearly, there has been no attempt to update the decor or even basic bedding. The hotel smells musty from age and old cigarettes. I will never stay here again it was creepy and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmeffsee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, second time here. The last time (Feb 09), the lobby bar was a hot spot. Jane Lynch (of Glee and 40 yr old Virgin) was there, and we played guitar and pool with Stephen Stills' daughter and grandson. This time, the pool table was gone, and so was the nightlife in the lobby. That being said, the room was clean and comfortable, bed was among the best hotel bed I've ever slept in, and the cafe had a very good breakfast and colorful wait staff telling stories of old hollywood to some of the guests there. The downside is the breakfast, like everything else in LA, was pricey at 30 dollars for the 2 of us, with no free continental like in some other hotels of the same price range. There is also no shop there for forgotten neccesities or souvenirs like in most hotels, though there is a grocery store across busy Venture Blvd. and drug/ convenience stores nearby. The hotel also charges 10.95 for internet access per day, which is crazy in today's world when so many places have free wifi. We were charged the 10.95 the first night, but I had wireless access for the entire 4 day stay. My suggestion would be to check your wifi before requesting access. The hotel also says it charges 10.00 per night for parking, another ridiculous charge. The hotel clerk reminded us of this at check in, however I never saw a charge on my bill. I think the hotel should eliminate these from their pricing structure as it made us think twice about staying there. They give you a parking pass and instruct you to place it on your dash. I forgot to one night and had a warning notice on the car the next morning. The pool is HUGE and clean. We spent an afternoon there while the poolside bar was open, with music and you could order from the cafe menu for poolside snacking /dining. The hotel is in a very nice area 10 minutes from Hollywood/Highland with easy access to everything in LA via the 101 which is a minute or 2 down the road. The concierge was very helpful in giving us Mapquest directions to Malibu, and the staff was attentive and polite. We could have paid much more to stay in a posh hotel, but this was an overall great value in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: sos122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge to be closer to friends who live in the Valley. It definitely saved us money, but it's not the best location if you're not planning to go to Universal Studios or that sort of thing. However, there's not really one great place to stay in LA since you have to drive virtually everywhere. The rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was friendly despite being overrun by 3 British school groups who were stranded in the US due to the volcanic eruption.
