My only complaint is that we booked the business suite specifically to have free wireless internet access, but even after multiple phone conversations with their technical support, it never worked. Overall, I think it's a good value for the price and perfect for families since it's not exactly romantic or hip.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Sportsmans Lodge”
Reviews.Author: SpikeSacramento_CA
Reviews.Content: I grew up about a mile from the Sportsman's Lodge. I left L.A. in the early 80's. Whenever I visit, I always stay at the S.L. In the 50's/60's, you could catch trout in their lake, but those are days gone by, however the hotel is still as cozy as ever. If you're looking for a modern, upscale hotel, this isn't the place. The Sportsman's Lodge offers comfortable, clean rooms, many with balconies overlooking the pool. Get a bottom floor and your steps away from a gorgeous full length pool and pool bar. The coffee shops serves lunch and breakfast poolside. Laying by the pool reminds me of famous L.A. hotels gone-by. It definitely has an Los Angeles/Valley feel. For me, it's a cozy spot in the midst of fine restaurants a walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: kdm0828
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to move rooms because we asked for a king and they put us in doubles. While we were at dinner they moved our luggage to another room. When we went back to the original room all of our stuff was gone. When I went to the desk they looked at me like I was crazy, they had switched staffing and no one communicated to one another where our luggage was. After 45 minutes if calling around they finally found our luggage. By this time my wife was already asleep in the original room so we slept there. The next morning we decided to move into the pool side king room that was finally given to us. There was a massive no smoking sign on the door but when we walked in the room wreaked so bad of smoke that my wife immediately ran into the bathroom and began throwing up in the toilet. Once she was done she had to stay out on the porch to get fresh air until I went back to the desk and figured out what to do. The desk told me they didnt have a room right then but they would move our stuff (again) to the new room when it was ready. We had planned on staying two nights and I told him we would like to check out then and skip the second night. He didn't even seem surprised by any of this, didn't offer a free night, sincere apology or anything. Overall it was the worst experience I have ever had at a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, easy going, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Emgray744
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a very welcoming feeling as well as clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff. The pool was amazing and the restaurant food was very good. On top of that the location and views from our room was perfect. Thanks for a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place was a huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: mathnerd31415
Reviews.Content: It was here or the Marriott just down the road. Both places were close to our destination, but we thought we'd give the Sportsman's lodge a try since it didn't appear to charge for parking. However, they did charge for parking which made the stay only $14 less than our stay at the close by Marriott. The lodge had late 70's wall paper throughout in spite of a claim to have been newly renovated and had paint pealing off allover the exterior. The Marriott is a way more modern hotel with better accomodations and waaaaayyyyy nicer rooms. Great exercise room at the Marriott too. In short don't stay at the Sportsman's lodge unless you absolutely have to. It's a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: yanochka78
Reviews.Content: Average across the board. I was expecting something much classier from the website. It had a feel of a Motel 6 but at a much higher cost. They charge for overnight parking ($10), and almost didn't give me our breakfast vouchers (croissant, coffee, fruit), until I specifically asked for them. Rooms were average, but clean and decent size. The "garden view" looked out on the parking lot. One big plus was free wireless internet. Would stay here again if the price was dropped significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Studio City”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelling_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenage daughter during February, 2010. LA turned on some nice warm weather for us! We were especially pleased when all we had heard prior to leaving that LA gets a lot of rain in February! Rain it did not, which was nice. We took the Prime Time Shuttle from LAX to our hotel. Was very efficient and we even got a "free" tour of Hollywood as the driver took a different route to Studio City so we could see some sights as we were the last to be dropped off. Upon arriving at the hotel we thought it looked rather nice. It has a huge car park and lovely gardens/trees. It is located across the road from Ralph's which was handy for groceries and there is also a coffee shop across the road, as well as a petrol/gas station at the end of the street. All of this about a 2-3 min walk from the hotel, depending on how fast you walk! There are many shops and boutiques along Ventura Blvd with something for most ages. The Sherman Oaks fashion mall isn't too far down Ventura either. The hotel's interior was old, but nice. It had a timeless kind of feel to it with all the pictures on the walls of old Hollywood actors and film-makers. The check-in staff were nice and helpful. We were helped with our bags as soon as we arrived so we didn't have to personally lug them to our room. A man by the name of 'Justino' was especially helpful and happy to help with anything we needed. He took our bags to our room for us and was very thorough with explaining everything. The lobby has an open fire, couches, bar, hair salon and business centre. We didn't use the internet though as our friends staying at the hotel had a laptop. The restaurant (Patio Cafe) is cute and decked out in all old-fashioned seats and tables. You feel like your in an old-time movie. The food was FABULOUS for reasonable prices and was able to be taken back to the room. The bathroom was squashy, but seemed to be OK for just the two of us. The shower was hard to work out at first, but I guess that's because we aren't from the United States! The TV had MANY, MANY channels which we enjoyed and had plenty of pay movies which are either old, classic, in cinemas or just released on DVD. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on and the pillows were amazing! I wanted to take one for myself! ;-) hehe Sleep was interrupted one night (we were on the 2nd floor). Kids were very noisy and a bus was parked outside the hotel with it's engine running which seemed to go on ALL night! We asked to move to the 5th floor, and the staff gladly helped us with that the next day. They also provide free wake-up calls!! We were pleased to see a table and chairs with an extra lamp in the room and got a "Welcome to LA" book to read. There is cupboard and drawer space and a nice lil balcony with a nice view of the mountains. Not sure if it was Laurel Canyon that we were looking at??? Downsides: -One elevator was out-of-service for the duration of our stay making it slower to get to and from the bottom of the hotel/lobby -Front desk people said there was no other way to get to Warner Bros studios apart from taking one of their private cars (Over $100 just to Burbank one way!!!) We ended up using public buses and got there for $5 return trip each!!!!!!!! Always explore all transport options! There is always more than one way!!! -Chemicals in the pool & spa were VERY strong, I'm guessing because of the large size of the pool. If your kids have sensitive skin I would just be wary of that. (But they should be fine because a little girl with severe skin problems went in the pool and she seemed to be OK surprisingly. But the kids did smell of chemicals when they got out. So there are pros and cons to the pool which is a great size though and can fit something like 150 people) -Noisy kids in the room next to us and people constantly slamming doors! -The perv looking down on the kids in the swimming pool one morning from the 4th floor. This is LA, watch your children!!! Apart from these few gripes, we liked the hotel and would probably stay here again. But not for long term. You can get better value elsewhere. Overall, we are glad we experienced the Sportsmen's Lodge in Studio City.

Reviews.Title: “Our Expectations were Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: GertrudeHeathcliff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this property and really enjoyed ourselves. We did not quite know what to expect but our expectations were exceeded. It is a classic hotel with a lot of history. The room was well appointed, the gardens were beautiful and well maintained, and the pool was absolutely perfect in size, cleanliness and temperature! The beds were very comfortable and of high quality. We experienced quiet nights of sleeping and used the continuous fan mode for white noise. It may have helped that we were on the 5th / top floor of one of the buildings overlooking the pool gardens and near the end of the hallway (would suggest such a request when reserving a room). The cafe is really cute - reminiscent of days gone by - and the breakfasts were terrific. The only complaints I have are that the furniture in the room was stained - beyond their prime - and the cafe service we received our last morning was inadequate. Otherwise, I would gladly return to this property as it positioned us near some great restaurants and sights, as well as the friends in Encino that we were visiting! Look for the managers' 24 hour sales which apparently are periodically offered on their web site - we got a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “I love the pool and location! So I keep comin back!!”
Reviews.Author: mstootles
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Amazing pool and pool bar! Old school charm. Clean and the remodeled bar lobby and fireplace are retro cool!! Great room service with a friendly smile. Food was great too!!! I will keep comin back.....able to drive to Malibu, Zuma Beach and The Grove at Farmers Market....awesome location!!! Room service waiter was so charming and happy. I love when people at work are nice and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at Sportsman Lodge”
Reviews.Author: BamaFanTuscaloosa_AL
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, excellent service. I will stay here again. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant hotelling experience”
Reviews.Author: bulty1978
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a place, we were so impressed with the staff of this hotel. It was our first stop in America and we were blown away by how pleasant and helpful the staff here were. The hotel itself was nice, our room was great and the facilities were excellent. We dined in the restaurant/cafe and the food was great and very generous. The waitresses were very friendly as well. The location was close to so many things and there is a supermarket right across the road and a great sushi place just next door. The shuttle service was included in our room price and took us right to Universal Studios not far away. We loved every part of the hotel including the bar and the cocktails they served. We would definately stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for accomodation in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: wallpaperbob
Reviews.Content: No complaints except that one of the two elevators in our building was not working for our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Comfie Beds, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Griztex
Reviews.Content: Yes, the lobby is out-of-date and and a couple of things could use new paint, but overall the hotel was clean, quiet (even though fully booked), comfortable, and convenient. The rooms appeared to have had a recent makeover. Furniture and carpet were in good condition, the bed had an extremely comfortable pillow-top mattress, and the bathroom was lacking the grout stains or smeared caulk that you see in truly run-down hotels. Each room had a nice porch area with chairs and a small table (the hand rail desperately needed painting, however). Overall, a great value at our $95/night rate. One aspect of the hotel that really stood out was that it is located in a nice neighborhood, rather than alongside a busy highway (although the highways are only a few blocks away). Ventura Blvd. around the hotel was fun to walk upon arrival. There are loads of shops, restaurants, wine bars, coffee shops, etc. The hotel cafe was fine for breakfast, but we were really pleased with the 24-hour deli/diner (Jerry's?) a half block down Ventura Blvd. for breakfast and late dinners/snacks. An Italian restaurant across the street (Risotto's) also deserves mentioning for very good fine dining. The supermarket across the street (Ralph's) served as our tailgate headquarters (we were going to the nat'l championship football game) and had everything we needed except a crying towel. A Starbucks is also just across the street and a Pete's coffee about two blocks down Ventura Blvd.. The olympic size pool surrounded by the courtyard was a big surprise and made me wish it weren't January. The most serious complaint that I had was not being allowed to use the luggage cart at check-in or checkout. We had to unload a Ford Expedition that was filled to the ceiling with all seats folded down for full cargo capacity. The cart really would have helped. We were told its use by guests was prohibited by their insurance company, but I think they should talk to their insurance carrier, or maybe another one. I haven't heard of a wave of luggage cart litigation gripping the country. I would have spent $40 on bellhop tips getting all that gear unloaded and later reloaded into car. I opted for being cheap and getting some exercise. A bottle of wine on the patio afterward made it all better.

Reviews.Title: “Casual Comfort with personal service”
Reviews.Author: driscdt
Reviews.Content: Excellent value in great location and with personal service that makes it feel like a private inn or bb. Universal package was a real value for a large family group.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay afortable i defitely used it again”
Reviews.Author: kristal99
Reviews.Content: the service was good it could it be better i think, for someone who use the hotel for the first time is good to do a quick tour of the place take that person to his/her room tell what time cafeteria opens etc, give some tips about the area like good places to go eat, the room was good the only think it should have is a microwave is good for family with young children it allways cames handy, the location is good because is not too far from universal studios, an is affortable, what I like the most wast the transportation to universal studios because I didn't have to worry about parking or how to get there and like I said is very conveniet and affortable I will defetely came back again thank you so much for the good service

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, unpretentious bargain”
Reviews.Author: InfrequentFlyer44
Reviews.Content: I grew up in LA, family is still there, so I need a place to stay at least once a year for the holidays. I drive there so I need convenient parking; I smoke so I need a smoking room; I bring my laptop so I need internet access. It's gotten very hard to find a reasonably priced hotel with those features anywhere near my family in Beverly Hills. I'm very glad to have found the Sportsmen's Lodge, an unpretentious but comfortable survival of the relaxed "old LA" I used to know. It's close to good restaurants of all kinds, there's a supermarket across the street, it's not that far from BH, just over Coldwater Canyon. My room was comfortable (very quiet even though it faced Ventura Blvd.), the plumbing was wonderful (how do they get away with all that water pressure in the shower?), the service was excellent, the price was very right (even with the $10/night parking fee). The only downside was a very slow but functional wifi connection that cost $9.95/day. I will definitely stay there on future trips to LA. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Service and comfort mean more to travelers these days”
Reviews.Author: Granite76
Reviews.Content: There is something charming about The Sportsmen's lodge that isn't obvious until you stay there. My girlfriend and I have been returning each year since about 1999 and will continue to do so. Located in a convenient part of Los Angeles, we quietly look forward to our stay as soon as our plane touches down at LAX. There is a consistent friendliness and helpfulness from the staff, all facilities are available the pool is delightful with sunshine all day long and no high-rises shadowing you as you recharge from a long journey. We leave behind snow and gray skies in London and calmly adopt the Californian pace as soon as we arrive. We mix with many other people who are similarly affectionate and appreciative of The Sportsmen's Lodge and we all share the same attitude to this " home from home" as we chat to each other around the pool. In over a decade now, I have yet to hear anyone complain when we've talked to people over breakfast, dinner or a swim. Thank you and see you again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask about parking before booking”
Reviews.Author: rbronte
Reviews.Content: Sportsmen's Lodge isn't bad. Room was relatively clean, tiny bath was clean as well. Thing that annoyed me was being informed of a $10 parking fee that wasn't mentioned during the booking process, or on the website. I'd stay here ONLY if you get a great rate (>$100)

Reviews.Title: “I love it”
Reviews.Author: BobBarnett
Reviews.Content: Yeah the rooms need updating But they are big, clean, great beds-and the pool area is still one of the best ever at a non resort. The trees planted 64 years ago, ringing the huge pool, with the poolside bar, just reek of classic Hollywood. And the coffee shop, completely remodeled in classic mid century style, looks great and has wonderful breakfasts. We paid $83 (+ approx $20 in taxes and parking). You can't beat that

Reviews.Title: “Amenities promised were not delivered”
Reviews.Author: cooperCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room in the hotel for my parents for one night, Dec. 18. They were hosting a Sweet 16 party for my daughter in the Event Center that night, and due to my father's recent knee surgery, they couldn't stay at my house as they usually did( I have steps up to the house). When I called the reservations desk, I told them of the situation, and requested a room with a handicap toilet. I was then offered, by the reservation clerk, a handicap room, with a walk-in shower, that he could easily get into. I was very appreciative of her consideration. However, when they checked in that day, they were given a room with a tub shower, and were told that the reservation didn't specify a handicap room. This created stress and an uncomfortable experience, on a night that should have been joyful for us all, I will never suggest to anyone that they stay at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We have been loyal - no more”
Reviews.Author: pharmate
Reviews.Content: Because we have family near this hotel, we have stayed their often over a 15 year period.. Each time we go, something isn't working - this time it was one of the two elevators servicing a large part of the hotel. These are small elevators, and they have to be used to transport laundry and cleaning trucks of the staff and the guests. The elevator that was broken had been broken for over month (see other reviews to confirm this). There was a sign on the door of the elevator that it was temporarily out of order. This is dishonesty. We were there on an off week. There were very few cars there when we came back to our room late at night, yet they charged us $10 a night to park, something that should have been waived during this period. They were skimpy with soap (i bar), quality of towels, shower cap,etc. We are sad, as we really looked forward to staying at this unusual place. Housekeeping was not a problem. The breakfasts that we had in the restaurant were just fine, but the service varied according to waitress. One lovely young lady (whose first name begins with a V) was so nice that we would walk in and ask her which tables she was serving, and we would sit there. On the last day, I used the business center to try to print out my boarding passes. I brought them up on the computer, but the printer didn't work. The desk clerk said she would print them out for me, and I asked her for my three dollars back for use of the computer. She said she couldn't do it; I would have to contact the owners. When i said that I wanted to contact the owners, she readily gave me my money. This is a great location - the hotel should be razed and a new hotel built there.

Reviews.Title: “Seems as if it is ready to close”
Reviews.Author: Burghound
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sportsmen's twice a year for the past ten years and have always liked the hotel and its restaurant.. But we stayed four nights over this Thanksgiving weekend, and had the feeling that the place was g etting ready to close although the employees deny it. Only one of the two elevators was working and no sign of anyone trying to repair the other one. The once very good restaurant is only open for breakfast and lunch now and seemed to be seriously understaffed. We had just one breakfast there and we waited over 30 minutes for it to be served and then everything was stone cold. The management needs to decide whether to close it or operate it properly.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great but....”
Reviews.Author: myoclonicjerk
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel itself was great, and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful . If i weren't for the below, I would definitely stay again. I booked the reservation 2 days before my arrival and made it clear that I needed a quiet room. Upon check-in, I again requested a quiet room, and was assured that my room was in a quieter area. The next night, one of the loudest outdoor parties I have ever experienced took place in their courtyard (adjacent to every room in the hotel.) It was a birthday party which included live music (complete with a man on a loud-speaker accompanying the music) and cheering, dancing, etc. This went on until 11:15 PM. Unfortunately, my evening of heavy work and hopes to be asleep by 9:30 were over. At one point, I was speaking on the phone to the airline, discussing my early morning flight, when the lady on the other end of the phone asked me to turn down my music, because she could not hear me well! My question is: why, when the party was surely booked two days before, when I made the reservation, was it not mentioned when, I repeatedly asked for a quiet room? It left me with the feeling that the management cares more about the money from their parties than satisfying their hotel guests. I would have gladly returned if they had been honest and recommended a nearby hotel. Also, the business center is deficient and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion customer service is still in fashion”
Reviews.Author: martini98
Reviews.Content: Check in took a little longer than necessary only because the lovely gentleman at the counter wanted to make sure I knew everything the hotel had to offer. This isn't the most modern of hotels but my room was very nice. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well. VERY convenient if you're going to the Rose Bowl. Freeway close. Being a solo female traveler, I felt very safe. The cafe was very nice for breakfast. I'd rather pay for a good cafe breakfast than get a free cheesy continental!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here If You Plan On Using The Shuttle To Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Randee1137
Reviews.Content: The bed was quite comfortable considering I'm used to sleeping on a Tempurpedic mattress. The remote wasn't bolted to the nightstand which was also nice. The sliding glass door leading to the balcony had sheer curtains as well as black-out curtains. The first light source when entering the room was very near the door (not in the middle of the room like some hotels I've stayed at). The room came with an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee pot, coffee and tea bags, ice bucket and liner, 6 shirt hangers and 6 pant hangers, suitcase holder, an extra blanket, a desk, two chairs, a vanity outside the bathroom (no chair), and a mini-fridge. The switch for the lamps on the nighstands were on the lamps themselves (I've stayed in hotels where I had to get out of bed to turn off the nightstand lamp), There was a recycling container for paper, cans, and bottles (nice touch!). There is a card for breakfast service that you hang on the doorknob. There is a "do-not-disturb" sign you can hang on the doorknob (Yes - I have actually stayed somewhere that did not have "do-not-disturb signs!). There is a back entrance that you can access with your room key (which is near the elevator and much closer to the parking lot). The wi-fi service is an additional $10 for 24 hours. The bathroom did not have a fan or a window. There was a vent over the shower but it did not have a motor. There were only two large bath towels (I'm used to four). There was only one bar of soap (instead of one for the sink and one for the shower). My biggest complaint, however, is regarding the shuttle service to Universal Studios. The current driver is consistently late leaving the hotel for the park and leaves the park early when bringing guests back to the hotel. The driver is required to write down a return time from the park (there are only 3 to choose from) for each guest he brings to the park. I chose 5 PM. I arrived at the pickup spot at 4:50. I waited until 5:15 to call the hotel because the driver never showed and I was told that he had already completed his 5 PM pickup. Then I was put on hold while they "tracked him down" but he couldn't be found. The hotel took my number and said they would call me back as soon as they found the driver. I decided to just take a cab. I was already back at the hotel by the time the front desk called me back. The shuttle service was the main requirement when I was researching hotels, so for this to be the subject of my biggest complaint is very disappointing. Like the title of my review states, don't stay here if you plan on using the shuttle to Universal Studios. Note: My reservation confirmation stated that parking was $10 per night. I was not charged parking for my stay, but I do not know if it was because it was comped due to the shuttle service incident, so if I were you I would call the hotel directly. I would only recommend this hotel to a friend if I could also warn them of the shuttle service, wi-fi fee, and lack of a bathroom window/vent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: dmgc727
Reviews.Content: The service was the absolute best I have ever encountered!! The front desk people were so nice and the restaurant gave us such great service. My daughter left her Ipod in the room and we did not realize it until we got home. They sent it to us within 2 days, we thought that we would never see it again!! The location is great if you want to sightsee and there is plenty of places to park. It is such a welcome change from all of the craziness of Hollywood. Perfect to relax in after a long day!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: rift96
Reviews.Content: The lodge is a great place to stay while visiting Studio City. It's in a great location if you're visiting nearby attractions such as Universal Studios. The lodge itself has a "aged", but very clean atmosphere to it that suits it well considering its history. The room was neat and clean with a relatively comfortable bed. The service staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. They were more than happy to talk about any local attractions, and even offer discount packages at the hotel for some locales.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lisa
Reviews.Content: The sportsmen's lodge had a great location for us. With their free shuttle to and from Universal was very convenient. There are lots of great restaurants and stores nearby like the Ralphs across the street. The only negative was that parking was $10 a day

Reviews.Title: “Average stay; a little pricey for what isn't included”
Reviews.Author: welikemacandcheese
Reviews.Content: According to other reviewers, parking at Sportmen's Lodge is "free", "$10", or "$10 but for us it was free". I dont know how to get on the special free-parking list but we paid $10 for each night we stayed. Considering the gigantic parking lot, I do not understand this; It's wrong to nickel and dime your customers, just include it in the cost of the room, right? We thought this hotel was just fine. It was the biggest room of three hotels we stayed at on our California trip, so that was nice. The old A/C unit takes some time to get going. The sign on the patio door about locking it twice was a little unnerving, but we did so. The bathroom was standard. Front counter staff was average. No real complaints, but nothing special or fancy. This is an old place which I love for the history, but we didn't spend much time here except to sleep. The bed was quite stiff, but the linens were soft. $9.95 for a day of internet service, so another nickel-and-dime tactic. Our room was spotlessly clean, and though the room and especially the hallway has an "old" smell, it's an old place, so I can't complain. Good central location to many attractions, Ventura is lined with plenty of restaurants and shopping, but I think for the price I should have gotten something in Universal City instead; something that had parking and internet included in the room cost, perhaps. One thing we really loved was our late-night walk to Twains restaurant just down the street (same side). It was fantastic. No-frills, delicious diner food, I believe open 24-hours, and for $10 a piece we had the most jambalaya, spaghetti and meatballs, mashed potatoes, garlic toast and chicken-fried steak we could possibly eat. It really cheered us up after a long day of driving around in unfamiliar territory; very homey, wonderful staff, dated but clean decor. We recommend Twains for sure if you're staying at the Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: twins1979
Reviews.Content: Had a good weekday stay at this hotel. Rooms were very clean and spacious for 2 guests. Hotel decor very outdated/stained but beds were new and comfortable and that's what mattered. Was a bit worried with no wall between patio decks but kept the patio door locked at all times to alleviate those worries. Friendly and prompt wait staff at the restaurant each morning. The "free" breakfast was pretty limited but got us going. Pool was wonderful, hot tub a little small but manageable. Drinks at poolside was very expensive but what bar in CA isn't. Many reviews stated loud on the weekends but our stay during the middle of the week was very quiet. Hotel a bit difficult to get out of on a busy Ventura Blvd. but not impossible. Shuttle to Universal was prompt and very convenient. Only real negative was the room service. Tried to order the pizza special but no luck. Called and no answer the first try, 2nd attempt they put us on hold for several minutes. Finally called the front desk and they referred us to a ma and pa pizza joint...pretty sad to lose business but in the end, great pizza. We did the Universal package (free park, free breakfast, 7 day tickets) which was a good value for a 2 night stay but if I had to pay the $159.00+ nightly rate, I would look elsewhere or keep watching for a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but fine.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingwithTeen53
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay here. It sort of trying for a cool ratpack kinda vibe. Although the hallways and lobby are a little shabby and the balcony railing was in sad disrepair our room was very clean and comfortable. . The staff was very accommodating. The pool is big and clean but many of the deck chairs were in need of repair. If you want quiet, don't get a pool room. there is a DJ on the weekends and it is a big party atmosphere. Great people watching if you are into that. We like the location right on Ventura Blvd. Easy access to Hollywood, B Hills, Universal Studios etc. If you are looking for luxury, this is not it. But if you just want a place to rest your head and maybe take a swim after a long day of theme parks and sightseeing its ok. Oh, and no exorbitant parking fees...in fact, no parking fee at all. So when you see the advertised price you don't have add 25 or 30 dollars a day plus tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal Studios with free shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: HabariYako
Reviews.Content: We pre booked two rooms for 3 nights on our PCH adventure from San Fran To Las Vegas primarily to visit Universal Studios.The staff were very helpful. Whist the hotel charges for parking ,this cost is off set by the complimentary shuttle bus to Universal Studios. ( Which as we found after a fun packed day, has a shopping precinct attached with all the bars and restaraunts and street entertainment. making for a great night out after if you have the stamina)) We found the rooms to be clean,quiet and comfortable. Great pool and jacuzzi with a busy pool bar. Busy as it was the only bar open! Good supermarket across the road for supplies and enough places to eat in the local area. well place to visit Santa Monica, Malibu, Paradise Cove and downtown LA.Good breakfast in the mornings with a wide choice. We enjoyed our stay, thought it was good value for the money,and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & loves dogs!”
Reviews.Author: WinkyBlinky
Reviews.Content: I love this place. They don't even blink if you have a small dog. Where other places charge you fees of don't allow them at all, Sportsmen's Lodge is truly pet friendly. This is also a great value. Our parking was free, although they said it was $10. The pool is really big and inviting. There are so many places to eat and shop, all within walking distance. A large store across the street can net you all your snacks and drinks. Starbucks is across the street too. There are a couple of places to eat on site as well. We had a great breakfast in the cafe where the staff has worked for 50+ years. The entire place was very clean and spacious. People call this place, "Long in tooth" which would be true, but we just love Sportsmen's Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway spot for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: motychr
Reviews.Content: With six kids at home, Sportsmen's is just ten minutes away from home, so we love to come here for an overnight getaway whenever possible. On our last stay we had a third floor pool view room. Very nice. The tropical landscaping outside the patio windows was beautiful. Next time we're going to try a ground floor room with direct access to the pool and poolside lounge. The bed was so comfy and I really enjoy the Bath and BodyWorks toiletries. The room was very clean and the temperature was great. We didn't bring the kids on this trip, but judging by the kids who were in the pool, they were having a great time. The music by the pool during the day was lots of fun. Great sized pool, so it never felt crowded. My only complaints...I always get frustrated with having to pay for parking, but considering the great rate we got using the hotel's website, it took the sting out of it. And I wish they would install inside door latches. Definitely a pleasant and relaxing weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shonC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience for us with two young kids. Location is very good if you have your own car and $10/day parking fee is reasonable. The area is good and feels safe at nights. Has few nice restaurants nearby. Recommends very much "rocco's" few blocks away. The rooms are spacious (except the bathroom) and has all necessary amenities. Staff is more than friendly and helpfull. The Patio cafe has great breakfasts. Pity it's not open evenings for dinner. The pool is just great, but the hot tub was not working. Shuttle to Universal is very convenient and free. Will surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time”
Reviews.Author: Big49fan
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Sportsmens Lodge....the pool area has to be the best feature of the hotel. Don't plan on getting to your room early...they say your room will be ready at 3 and they won't give you the keys until 3...no early check in heres so make sure you plan your arrival time until after 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shawnie23
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel. Not only was the staff freindly and informative, the room was very spacious. We would stay here again and again. It was only a shuttle bus drive away from Universal Studio which saved us the frustration of getting there but also saved us the parking fee. Our only negative observations were that the hot tub wasn't very hot and the carpet in our room could use a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Lith
Reviews.Content: Was easy to get to Hollywood without being right in the centre of it all. A quiet area with a few restaurants and amenities around. Hotel standards are excellent, lovely rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for studios, average service”
Reviews.Author: travelexplore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approx. 35 minutes from LAX airport (shuttle buses take longer, but are cheaper). The staff are helpful, but service is rather slow (it took 3 days for my pre-ordered fruit basket to arrive). My double king room was spacious and comfortable. Having a fridge means you can stock up on breakfast foods/snacks (there's a supermarket across the street). However, the decor is dated - the country lodge look is too dark and heavy for sunny LA and could do with a revamp. And internet service is $10 per day, when it should really be free, considering the price of the room. I suggest that you book this hotel at least a month in advance so you get the Advance Purchase rate, which is much more reasonable. (The peak rates are ridiculous for a 3 star hotel!). I had a rather uninspiring street view from my balcony, but pool view rooms are probably too noisy, with the DJ playing by the pool all afternoon, kids splashing around until quite late and rowdy adults at the pool bar in the evenings! For a hotel that welcomes many international guests, they can only cash $50 worth of travellers cheques each day, which was rather frustrating! This hotel is excellently located for trips to Universal Studios (tickets and transport arranged by the hotel) and Warner Bros Studios (I highly recommend the Warner Bros VIP Tour!) And it's not far from the nightlife in West Hollywood. But it's a very long drive to the beaches, what with the incessant traffic. As such, I'd recommend hiring a car, or you'll spend all of your allowance on taxis! (Although it is $10 a day to park at the hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “A real gem with outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: anthonyclan
Reviews.Content: Emails to hotel websites don't often get speedy replies. Sportsmens Lodge replied withing 5 minutes to every emailed enquiry. Excellent customer service, friendly staff, huge swimming pool, good sized rooms. Supermarket straight across the road and hotel is sited on main bus route. Great holiday. Noisy in the weekends but rooms seem to be soundproofed as we didn't hear a thing with the patio door closed.

Reviews.Title: “Good ratio price-quality, fantastic location, good pool”
Reviews.Author: antonio_b1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, strategic position to visit Holliwood area, 20 min away from LAX airport. Confortable & clean rooms, friendly staff, efficient complimentary shuttle service to Universal Studios, good internet reservation system, nice pool. Too noisy on week-end, due to high level of music in pool area. Missing w-lan service in rooms, available for a fee

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: holllywood
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I love staying at the Sportsmen's Lodge. When we found out that we could take our rescue puppy too, we new why we loved this place so much. The people are friendly, the rooms are clean~Thank you very much for being there for us!! See you soon! Kim and Jazzy

Reviews.Title: “The price is tricky”
Reviews.Author: CCIntlConnections
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for a delegation from China. On the website, it shows $93/person/night, including 2 Universal Studio tickets and breakfast. However, when they checked out, the bill listed tickets and room rate separated. The ticket prices were higher than what we can buy at the door and we could get better room rate than that. I stayed a hotel that offered vacation package. It didn't list tickets and room separately. Just be careful next time when you make reservation and make sure what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool but Noisey at Night”
Reviews.Author: Domer90mom
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our 3 children, ages 12,11, and 8 stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge for 3 nights in late June while visiting the LA area. I really have mixed feelings about the place. Overall, I would say I enjoyed our stay, but there are some aspects about this hotel that one should be aware of. The location is excellent. Very close to many of the usual tourist attactions in LA-Universal Studios, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, etc. Our room was very clean and comfortable, although we were disappointed to learn that we could not get a roll away in our room that already had 2 queen beds. The public areas in the hotel are looking a bit worn. I suspect the hotel was at one time "the place" to stay in the Valley. If you check out their website, they are sort of pretending to be something they are not anymore. One of the main reasons I chose this hotel was because of what apearred to be a great swimming pool, which is of course of significant importance if you are traveling with children. I must say that the pool itself was truly excellent. It's huge, heated, and very clean. There are plenty of lounge chairs and a nice pool bar. You can tell that the pool is the main focus of the hotel. Half of the rooms have a pool view as we did with a second floor balcony and it was really a nice view. But here's the rub. While the pool is great, the people hanging around it are really not. As has been suggested in other reviews, it can get pretty loud at night if you have a poolview room. Right below our room there was a group being pretty loud until 10 or 11 at night. I can't blame them-they're on vacation and having fun. But it kind of sucks when you're on a 2 hr time change and you're trying to get some sleep. Luckily we were not there on a weekend night when it sounds even worse with live music. One night there was a group of ten 17 or 18 years old playing in the pool, and being loud welll after the pool had closed at 9pm. To the hotel's credit, I did see a hotel employee come out at around 10p to tell them that the pool was closed, and after about 20 min of continuing to screw around, they finally got out, and after another 30 min of making more noise at the poolside they finally took it inside. Another aspect of the pool that bothered my wife more than me, was that it really wasn't a great "family atmosphere". Nothing terrible, but watching some fat 50 something year old guy making out in the pool with his wife/girlfriend/bimbo in front of my kids just isn't really cool. So, would I stay here again. Maybe. My kids actually enjoyed it a lot. They loved the pool. I had my earplugs with me so I managed. It was a fun place, and if you're a couple looking for a hotel with a good pool scene and don't mind staying up late, then you'll probably enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a family favorite!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dynomutt
Reviews.Content: We were here for business and friends. I was very disturbed when checking in on Saturday night. The hotel's crowd seemed like something between a swinger scene and a biker bar, complete with inebriated older women hitting on older men. That's not what you want with little kids. It was very disconcerting and upsetting. The pool water was very murky. Grounds are nicely kept. More kids did show up while we were there, but this is definitely not a family atmosphere. The carpet was stained and clearly not cleaned in a long time, the ceiling in the shower was bowed - seemed to be from humidity and/or mildew. The room was always far more humid than outside. The cleaning crew often didn't replenish something... one day it was washcloths, a few times it was shampoo, soap, etc. This hotel charges about $10 for Internet Access, $10 for parking, and ridiculous amounts of money for the "media center" use ($3 just to get the computer to turn on). There aren't any snack machines! So, at 11pm when we wanted a candy bar, we were referred to the gas station next door or the grocery store across the street. We didn't get around to the restaurant, but it seemed to be popular.

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy! LOUD music!”
Reviews.Author: MountainGal08
Reviews.Content: We were "upgraded" upon our arrival to poolside. Little did we know that there would be people sitting at tables ten feet from our sliding door talking loudly for hours. The worse part was the series of live lounge singers with electric guitars and amplified music - at "POOLSIDE" who sang REALLY LOUD until 11 pm. (It was a Friday night.) We've stayed at a lot of hotels and this kind of thing has never happened to us. We called the front desk and asked to change rooms but were told that they were all booked up. They said the music ended at 10 pm....then later when we called they said it ended at 11 pm. This is the first hotel review I've ever written; I felt compelled because this experience was so bad. It's the kind of thing where you keep telling yourself, "This is insane!" I paid $200 per night for what I thought would be a quiet night in a convenient location near where I was conducting some business. Instead I ended up in front row seats FOR THREE HOURS to a series of poolside singers - none of whom were very good. The room was nonsmoking but smelled like cigarettes, although that happens at a lot of hotels. There was one good part to the stay - after we realized we were "stuck" in that room - we laughed a lot since the singing was comical - especially the one who sounded like he was from The Godfather and sang "O Solo Mio" really LOUD. We had friends staying on the back alley side of the hotel and they couldn't hear the music, so if you have to stay here and want a quiet room and a good night's sleep book at that end of the hotel. Good luck! Half of the hotel's rooms are "poolside."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparkintheDark
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay here for a business trip and it was a great experience. Reasonable rates and good service all round from friendly staff. A great casual atmosphere. Only drawback is that there is not much to do in the immediate surrounding area of the hotel, but if you're just looking for a base from which to discover Hollywood and Studio City then this is definitely one to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: blueknight
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife stayed at this three star hotel for four night in January 2009 and was good value for money at $80 (Â£60) a night. It was close to Universal studios of which the hotel runs a courtesy bus and only 6 miles from Hollywood boulevard ($15 in a taxi) with the hotels there costing three times as much, so this was good value. We have stayed in many luxury hotels and the rooms at this hotel were comparable. The outdoor pool was heated in the winter with a hot jacuzzi poolside. On appearance we thought the hotel looked like a cheap motel, but this hotel really was of good standard for what we paid, certainly better than motel standard. It had a moderately priced restaurant, with an internet room, and a hair salon. Outside the hotel across the roads there was a starbucks, and down to the left there was an excellent 24 hour diner called jerry's. There was also a ralph's shopping center across from the hotel for those essentials. To conclude the best feature of the hotel was the room and the hot swimming pool, everything else was just better than average, but for the price and for the locality to universal and hollywood, i would recommend to those budget seekers looking for decent but affordable standards.

Reviews.Title: “Down to earth place”
Reviews.Author: duckie81
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Sportsmen's Lodge Hotel was one of the most comfortable "down to earth" places I have ever stayed. There is a certain benevolent feeling about the place.That lodge feeling allows you to forget that you are in the heart of the city. It feels more like you are out in the country somewhere. The rooms are clean and cozy. The beds in the rooms have been recently upgraded and so you don't have to worry about old rickety mattresses. The new down linens and pillows are a nice touch. What I liked most about the hotel was just the overall vibe, its unique, cool and casual. The staff there is great. Everyone is very warm and welcoming. I would definitely stay here again and would refer it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The Sportsmen's Lodge Is A Winner”
Reviews.Author: NobodysBaby
Reviews.Content: My stay with the Sportsmen's Lodge was excellent. The greeting by the hotel staff was the first level of excellence. My room was squeakly clean and the bed was so comfortable. The grounds are unbelievable, once you pull in the parking lot it is easy to forget that you are in the city. As you explore the poolside area and see the area that is available for outdoor events you will be amazed and the buffers for sound like the waterfalls and foliage. Yes, it is a beautiful spot for an outdoor event. Parking in LA is a huge issue, the Sportsmen's Lodge has ample parking. The Sportsmen's Lodge has been chosen as our host hotel for the upcoming Welcome Home to Jericho Charity Event scheduled for April 2009 and I am extremely pleased this hotel has been our winning choice!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and well priced”
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge for work for 3 nights. The hotel feels somewhat like it has been stuck in 1962, complete with kitschy astroturf ringing the pool. The room that I had was on the 3rd floor and faced the pool. This only presents a problem if you want to get to sleep early as the pool is frequented until about 11pm. Room and furnishings appear to have been updated within the last few years and were quite clean and well kept. Hallways and lobby are beginning to show their age but are quite clean. The hotel restaurant was under renovation during my stay so a temporary dining room had been set up in one of the hotel's conference rooms. The wait staff still appeared to be ironing out the details of this change. As I only had breakfast (cereal and fruit) at the hotel I can't comment on the quality of the food though the selection looked decent for all meals. Staff at reception were quite friendly and happily made taxi reservations to the airport, etc. Overall the hotel is comfortable, clean and offers a decent value for LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel except for the flies”
Reviews.Author: Theholidayplanners
Reviews.Content: On arrival our room was not ready as we were early however the Receptionist was very helpful, booking a trip for the next day for us. We had asked for a 'city view' room thinking we would be able to see downtown but we just had a view of a grassy wooded area in which there must have been some stagnant water. We opened the patio to have a look round when we first got into the room & noticed the fly screen but didn't pay much attention to it. (we've never used one). Unfortunately we left the door open which was enough time for a few flies to join us. Daft as it may seem I couldn't sleep that night although my husband had got rid of all the flies we could see at the time, and he got rid of a couple more when we came in later on - I just felt like there were things crawling on me all night. (There weren't!). It would have been better if there had been a note on the doors warning you to keep the fly screen closed at all times. I was absolutely shattered the next day when we were doing most of our sightseeing. Other than this the room was spacious and the beds very comfortable. A coffee maker was provided plus a fridge and there was a hairdrier and an iron and ironing board. There was no safe in the room and when we asked for one of the safety deposit boxes at Reception there were none left. One of the Receptionists said he would let us know if one became available but one didn't. We had a problem with the sink not draining when we arrived (would have thought the maid would have spotted that when she cleaned the room prior to our arrival?) We reported it and someone came to fix it quite quickly. The toilet also sometimes needed to be flushed twice but that was not a major problem. The room had a connecting door which was a bit disconcerting when the people next door sounded like they were trying to come through. The dividing railings between all the balconies are also quite low, and there are warnings to keep doors locked at all times. There was a fixed head shower in the bathroom and the wardrobe had 10 hangars. There was a laundry facilty at the hotel which can be quite useful if you are travelling around a lot. The pool area was nice and used by lots of people, towels were provided . There was a bar at one end. One morning we were going out very early and ordered a room service breakfast, eggs & sausage & toast. Don't bother - it was all at varying stages between lukewarm and cold. The next day we went down to the cafe which was better although we waited a while to be served. Internet access was available just off the lobby by using cash or credit card. The location is convenient for road access but there is not a lot nearby if you are wanting to explore on foot. We got a taxi up to Studio City in the evening but not as much to do there as we had hoped. Wouldn't stay there again but probably OK if you are driving everywhere and you get a room with a pool view.

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sal.gram
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is in the old style but we loved it. The room was comfortable for 3 of us with plenty of space and it was clean. The service at the front desk was generally very good. We used the free shuttle service to Universal Studios and they also booked us tickets.From the bedroom we had a view of the pool and the hills beyond which I would recommend asking for. The pool was big and warm. At night they put candles around the pool which made it look very attractive. When we were there they were just about to host their annual cowboy gathering ( real ones and film ones!) and so there was some nice singing around the pool by men in stetsons! We also got chating to a guy who claimed he was a TV director- real LA!! Breakfast was served in the restaurant and you could order food around the pool. I have not given this hotel 5 because the restaurant and bar shut at 9pm!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: vmer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here two times with my family and we couldn't have been more satisfied with the place. I'll admit that it is outdated, for the most part, although some rooms were renovated a couple of years ago but the rooms remain very clean and spacious. The hotel has two restaurants, one casual and the other white tablecloth, and both offer excellent food at reasonable prices. The Olympic-size pool is wonderful for serious swimmers and frolickers alike, and a cute tiki bar offers every favorite libation. The grounds around the hotel could use some sprucing up, though. Some staff members seemed a little indifferent to the needs of guests but most were nice enough. The neighborhood is safe and walkable with many restaurants and shops located up and down Ventura Blvd., including a Ralph's grocery store just across the street that is open 24 hours. The location, itself, is very convenient to any other area attractions that beckon tourists. I highly recommend staying here if you don't mind a laid-back, unpretentious atmosphere. The rates are reasonable and the parking is free, which normally isn't the case in the LA area. I would definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great pool”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Studio City near by shops and restaurants. The hotel is currently being renovated, which hopefully will improve the rooms, that were ok, but needed a "make over". The hotel has a great pool, and there are a cafe (open for breakfast, lunch and dinner - the breakfast was fine), a bar & grill and a restaurant. Parking cost about 10 $ pr. day, internet access cost about 3 $ for 10 or 15 minutes (at the hotels computer). Most nights there were a lot of noise from the bar/parties at the hotel, which was irritating. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Flythere1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this Hotel prior to arriving in LA, and were pleased that we did. The hotel is in a reasonable part of Ventura Blvd, with the usual eateries close-by. Its a simple 30 minute drive from LAX, and its close to Universal City for the attractions. Central for the other area's: Beverly hills, Hollywood etc..Room large enough and clean. Pool area was airy and has a bar. You can purchase breakfast at the restaurant near the pool which is excellent value. We had two nights here, and would have stayed longer had we not "done" all of the LA sights. Overall excellent find.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Nelly66
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for 5 nights in total. The place had been recommended to us by an LA local, and we weren't disappointed. Our room (a standard king) was huge and well appointed. The staff were very helpful, arranging transport for us around the city, among other things, and were only too willing to help. The valley location was fantastic - close to Studio City, and along Ventura within easy walking distance from the hotel - Jerry's Famous Deli, Iroha sushi, Il Tramezzino (for a great lunch panini), Ole spanish and tapas restaurant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not great for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadtoomuch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lodge because the rates were good compared to other hotels in the area. The room was clean. The staff was very friendly. The decor is a bit 'tired' and shabby. Overall, though, it was a clean, pleasant stay EXCEPT when it came to getting business done. The wireless service was spotty, especially in the mornings. I wouldn't have minded paying for it if it had worked properly. Will I stay again? Not sure. Great deal for tourists but not necessarily for business folks. One additional note. I saw some of the other reviews where guests complained about the decor, the food, etc. Come on, folks, what are you expecting for prices like this? You want five-star hotel services, book a room at $300/night hotel. This is a decent, relatively inexpensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ripejack
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a second time, for 6 nights, following a good experience 2 years ago, when I stayed for 10 nights. In a country where hotel and restaurant staff can never seem to do enough for you, the staff at the Sportsmens Lodge were ignorant, unhelpful and generally couldn't care less about my stay or my partners stay. Whilst the pool scene is very pleasant, the rooms are VERY dated and our bathroom had definitely seen better days. I shall never return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the vibe (and breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: tourmaager
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I love this hotel, not flashy at all, clean rooms with the neccesary stuff. It got a vibe to it, kinda rock'n'roll. Great location, easy access to main freeways. Staff is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overall way too noisy and now they charge for parking”
Reviews.Author: fgrsk8r
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge for a big event and upon arrival learned that the new owners now charge $10 a day for parking. I find that outragious. They also charge $10 for internet, although some rooms include it for free... now I don't understand that at all.... most hotels include wi-fi in today's world for free. So now it's an extra $20 on top of the room. Can't use the luggage/bell carts anymore (they are locked down and again, we were informed that the new management doesn't allow guests to use them), you have to get the bell man (which obviously needs to be tipped then). And dispite the fact that it's a great location, great pool and surroundings .... the noise was awful. Several events were going on outside and in the bar area and we wouldn't have gotten any relaxation if we wanted to either inside our room and for sure not outside. People walk past the downstairs "patio" area, because it doesn't have a private barrier - so when we sat in our chairs infront of our patio door, everybody and the world used the path as a shortcut.... very annoying. We wished we had a higher floor just so we'd have the privacy of the balcony. Overall I was very disappointed because for the price we could have stayed three nights at a Best Western ... including breakfast, free internet and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: santasons
Reviews.Content: I will never set foot in the building again. During my stay a burglar came into our room on the third floor WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING and stole my briefcase with a little over $5k in cash. While we were unable to prove it, the most likely thief was an employee of the hotel,as entry was gained through the balcony from an adjacent room. The hotel denied my insurance claim before I had ever made one. I refused to pay my bill, but other than that no compensation was ever offered. My name is Mark Rohlfs and I am the owner of Santa & Sons Christmas Trees.

Reviews.Title: “Third time and still enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: tadjr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice before many years ago and was worried about suggesting we stay here reading some of the recent reviews. It turned out to be a nice experience again. The hotel is older and could use some updating, but it is a "lodge" look for a reason. The hotel was clean and comfortable and quiet for being on the busy street its on. Lots of room in the room, bed comforatble and hot water in the shower. The cafe had good food and was inexpensive considering its in a hotel and in LA. We didnt use the pool, but it looked very inviting and a good place to relax. Considering some of the recent replies here I guess we just got lucky? I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: drooper2
Reviews.Content: Stay elsewhere, coming to L.A. or planning an event. We held a special event here, brought in loads of out of town guests, and lived to regret it. It was a constant series series of problems, enough to form a pattern and not just bad luck - from them booking our room out from under us, to closing the bar before our pre-booked event, to overcharging us - after we had checked out! Add to this a surly staff and mediocre rooms. Moral of the story - a one-time Valley landmark that clearly now only caters to film crews (they were there before we got there and took over the place after we left) and is no longer interested in serving tourists or public guests. If you had a good stay, you got lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted so much to love it!”
Reviews.Author: Summer1234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Sportsmen's Lodge three times now and each time we leave, we wish we could say we couldn't wait to return. It's not a bad place to stay. The room was comfortable and clean, the food was good and the pool was great. We just get the feeling each time that management doesn't care enough to take a hotel with such great potential that extra step, particularly in a city as sophisticated as L.A.! The first thing we noticed when we got there was the smell in the lobby. Was it mildew or just old carpeting? The bathroom off the lobby was even worse. The gift shop was another disappointment with dusty old products with unknown brands we would never consider buying We had to ask for new pillowcases because the ones we got were so yellow. Fortunately, our room was very quiet and we got a good night's sleep. If you are used to three star hotels, you'll probably think it's fine. We just expect more from a hotel these days, particularly when the room rates are so high.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: allisonness
Reviews.Content: Thi is an awful place to stay. The bathroom as dirty as well as the carpeting in our room was worn. It was very noisy with paper thin walls and you could hear people in their rooms flush their toilets at all hours of the night. Not a convenient place to get in and out of due to a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “The Real L.A. (Valley version)”
Reviews.Author: badpatti
Reviews.Content: The Sportsmenâ€™s Lodge Hotel More than lodging. This is a slice of L.A. life. Weâ€™re natives who have moved on, but go back each year to see family in the Valley. The week we stayed there was some sort of Change-Your-Life seminar there. The place was crawling with showbiz wannabes and never-was-es.
